translations.source_text: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.
translations.pred_target_text: "Kei a maatau nga kiore 4-marama te pakeke kaore i te mate huka i mua i te mate huka," ka tapiritia e ia.
translations.true_target_text: "Kei a tātou ināianei ngā kiore e 4-marama te pakeke kāore i te pāngia e te mate huka, ahakoa i mua i pāngia e te mate huka," tana kōrero tāpiri.

translations.source_text: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko Dr. Ehud Ur, ahorangi mo te rongoa i te Whare Wananga o Dalhousie i Halifax, Nova Scotia me te heamana o te wehenga haumanu me te pūtaiao o te Canadian Diabetes Association i whakatupato ko te rangahau kei roto tonu i ona ra tuatahi.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā whakatūpato a Tākuta Ehud Ur, Ahorangi mō te Rongoā ki Te Whare Wānanga o Dalhousie, kei Halifax, Nova Scotia, ko te heamana hoki mō ngā mahi whakamātau rongoā, pūtaiao hoki ki te Canadian Diabetes Association, kei te mata tonu ngā mahi rangahau.

translations.source_text: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.
translations.pred_target_text: Pērā i ētehi atu tohunga, kei te pohehe ia mena ka taea te rongoa te mate huka, me te mahara ko enei kitenga karekau he paanga ki nga tangata kua pa ki te mate huka Momo 1.
translations.true_target_text: Pēnei i ētahi atu tōhunga, kei te ruarua kē ōna mahara e pā ana ki te whakaora i te mate huka, me te mōhio iho kāore ēnei kōrero e hāngai ana ki te hunga kua pāngia kētia ki te mate huka momo 1.

translations.source_text: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
translations.pred_target_text: I te Mane, ko Sara Danius, hekeretari tuturu o te Komiti Nobel mo nga Tuhituhi i te Whare Wananga o Huitene, i panuitia i roto i te kaupapa reo irirangi i runga i te reo irirangi o Sveriges i Sweden te komiti, kaore i taea te tae tika atu ki a Bob Dylan mo te wikitoria i te Nobel Prize in Literature 2016, kua whakarerea. ana kaha ki te toro atu ki a ia.
translations.true_target_text: I te Mane, i whakapuaki tūmatanuitia e ara Danius, te hekeretari ū o te Nobel Committee for Literature ki te Swedish Academy, i tētahi hōtaka reo irirangi ki Sveriges Radio ki Huitene ko te komiti, kāore i te āhei ki te whakapā tōtika atu ki a Bob Dylan mō tāna toa i te 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, kua whakarere i āna mahi ki te pā atu ki a ia.

translations.source_text: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
translations.pred_target_text: I kii a Danius, "I tenei wa kaore matou e mahi. I waea atu ahau me te tuku imeera ki tana hoa mahi tino tata, a kua tae mai nga whakautu tino pai.
translations.true_target_text: Nā Danius i kī, "Ināiatonunei kāore mātou i te paku aha. Kua waea atu au, kua tuku īmēra anō hoki ki tōna hoa mahi ngātahi tata rawa, ā, kua tae mai he whakahoki tino hoahoa. Mō tēnei wā, kua nui tērā."

translations.source_text: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.
translations.pred_target_text: I mua, i kii te Tumuaki o Ring, a Jamie Siminoff, i timata te kamupene i te kore e rangona tana pere kuaha mai i tana toa i tana karati.
translations.true_target_text: I mua atu, nā te CEO o Ring, nā Jamie Siminoff i kī, i tīmata te kamupene i te wā kāore tāna pere kuaha i te rangona mai i tana toa ki tōna karāti.

translations.source_text: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.
translations.pred_target_text: I hangaia e ia he pere kuaha WiFi, ka kii ia.
translations.true_target_text: I hangaia mai e ia he pere kuaha ahokore.

translations.source_text: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.
translations.pred_target_text: I kii a Siminoff kua piki ake nga hoko i muri mai i tana ahuatanga i te tau 2013 i roto i te wahanga o te Shark Tank i kore ai te roopu whakaaturanga e tuku putea mo te tiimata.
translations.true_target_text: I kī a Siminoff i piki ake ngā hokonga whai muri i tana putanga i te hōtaka Shark Tank i te tau 2013 i te wā kāore te paewhiri o te hōtaka i whakaae kia hoatu moni mō te timatanga o te pākihi.

translations.source_text: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.

translations.true_target_text: I te mutunga o te tau 2017, i kitea a Siminoff ki te hongere pouaka whakaata hoko, ki QVC.

translations.source_text: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

translations.true_target_text: I whakatau hoki a Ring i tētahi take ture ki te kamupene whakahaumaru tātāwhāinga, ko te ADT Corporation.

translations.source_text: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection.
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa te ahua ka taea e tetahi kano kano whakamatautau ki te whakaheke i te mate Ebola, tae noa mai ki naianei, kaore ano kia kitea he raau taero e tika ana mo te rongoa i nga mate o naianei.
translations.true_target_text: Ahakoa ko te āhua o tētahi rongoā āraimate e whakamātautauhia ana he āwhina pea i te mate mai i te Ebola, tae noa mai ki tēnei wā, karekau he rongoā kua pai te whakaatu kia whakamaimoa i te pokenga kua pā kē.

translations.source_text: One antibody cocktail, ZMapp, initially showed promise in the field, but formal studies indicated it had less benefit than sought in preventing death.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tetahi rongoa antibody, ko ZMapp, i whakaatu tuatahi i te oati i roto i te mara, engari i kii nga rangahau okawa he iti ake te painga i te rapu mo te aukati i te mate.
translations.true_target_text: Kotahi te pāhekoheko paturopi, te ZMapp, i whakaatu tuatahi i ētahi putanga papai i te mātai, heoi nā ngā rangahau ōkawa i whakaatu he iti ake ngā painga i tērā i pīrangitia mō te haukoti i te mate.

translations.source_text: In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it.

translations.source_text: USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes.

translations.true_target_text: Kei te tautoko a USA Gymnastics i te reta a te United States Olympic Committee, ā, kei te whakaae ki te hiahia waiwai o te whānau Olympic hei tuku i tētahi taiao haumaru mō te katoa o ā mātou kaipara.

translations.source_text: We agree with the USOC's statement that the interests of our athletes and clubs, and their sport, may be better served by moving forward with meaningful change within our organization, rather than decertification.

translations.source_text: USA Gymnastics supports an independent investigation that may shine light on how abuse of the proportion described so courageously by the survivors of Larry Nassar could have gone undetected for so long and embraces any necessary and appropriate changes.
translations.pred_target_text: Kei te tautoko a USA Gymnastics i tetahi whakatewhatewha motuhake e whiti ana mo te mahi kino o te wahanga i whakamaaramatia maia e nga morehu o Larry Nassar i kore e kitea mo te roa me te awhi i nga huringa e tika ana.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tautoko te takaporepore USA i tētahi tirohanga motuhake e rewa ake ai ngā āhutanga whakamanioro o ngā mahinga i kōrerotia māiangia e ngā mōrehu o Larry Nassar, i āhei pea te haere hara kore mō te wā roa, ā, ahakoa te tīnitanga, me mahi.

translations.source_text: USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics, and others, as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe, positive and empowered environment.

translations.true_target_text: He ōrite nei tā USA Gymnastics me tā USOC whāinga - i runga i tēnā kia āta manaakitia te hākinakina takahurihuri kia taea ai e ngā kaiaka te whai i ā rātou whāinga i roto i tētahi taiao manaaki me te tiaki.

translations.source_text: Throughout 1960s, Brzezinski worked for John F. Kennedy as his advisor and then the Lyndon B. Johnson administration.

translations.true_target_text: Mō te roanga o ngā tau 1960, i mahi a Brzezinski mā John F. Kennedy hei kaitohutohu, ā, katahi ko te tari o Lyndon B. Johnson.

translations.source_text: During the 1976 selections he advised Carter on foreign policy, then served as National Security Advisor (NSA) from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto i nga whiringa 1976 i tohutohu ia ki a Carter mo nga kaupapa here ke, katahi ka noho hei Kaitohutohu Haumaru Motu (NSA) mai i te tau 1977 ki te 1981, i muri ia Henry Kissinger.
translations.true_target_text: I te wā o ngā kōwhiringa 1976 i tohutohu ia ki a Carter mō ngā kaupapa here ā-ao, ā, kātahi ia ka tū hei National Security Advisor (NSA) mai i te tau 1977 ki te tau 1981, ka whai i a Henare Kissinger.

translations.source_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.
translations.pred_target_text: Hei NSA, i awhina ia ia Carter ki te whakahaere i nga take o te ao, penei i te Camp David Accords, 1978; te whakarite i nga hononga US-Haina i te mutunga o nga tau 1970; te Revolution Iranian, i arahina ki te raruraru mauhere Iran, 1979; me te whakaekenga a Soviet i Afghanistan, 1979.
translations.true_target_text: I tōna tūranga ki te NSA, i tautoko ia i a Carter i roto i ngā take huhua o te ao, pērā ki ngā take ki Camp David i te 1978, ngā mahinga ngātahi i waenga i a Amerika me Haina i te pito o ngā tau 1970, ngā uauatanga ki Iran i hua ai te raru nui ki reira i te tau 1979 me te urutomonga o te Soviet ki roto o Afghanistan i te tau 1979.

translations.source_text: The movie, featuring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, received nominations in all major categories.

translations.source_text: Two songs from the movie, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) and City of Stars, received nominations for best original song. Lionsgate studio received 26 nominations — more than any other studio.

translations.true_target_text: E rua ngā waiata i te kiriata, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) me City of Stars, i whiwhi whakaaringa mō te waiata tūturu pai rawa. I whiwhi a Lionsgate studio i te 26 whakaaringa - he nui ake i tētahi atu taupuni mahi.

translations.source_text: Late on Sunday, the United States President Donald Trump, in a statement delivered via the press secretary, announced US troops would be leaving Syria.

translations.true_target_text: I te mutunga o te Rātapu, i roto i tētahi tauāki nā te Perehitene o Amerika nā Donald Trump i te heketeri o ngā perehi, i kī ai ka wehe ngā hōia Amerika i a Syria.

translations.source_text: The announcement was made after Trump had a phone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

translations.true_target_text: I whakapuakina whai muri i te kōrero ā-waea a Trump ki te Perehetini nō Tākei a Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

translations.source_text: Turkey would also take over guarding captured ISIS fighters which, the statement said, European nations have refused to repatriate.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka mau ano a Turkey ki te tiaki i nga kaiwhaiwhai ISIS i mauhia, e ai ki te korero, kaore nga iwi Pakeha i pai ki te whakahoki mai.
translations.true_target_text: Ka whai mana hoki a Tākei mō te tiaki i ngā kaiwhawhai ISIS kua mauheretia, arā, e ai ki te puakitanga, kua karo ngā whenua Ūropi ki te whakahoki atu i a rātou.

translations.source_text: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement.
translations.pred_target_text: Ehara tenei i te whakau i te mea he huruhuru etahi mokoweri, he ariā kua horapa noa atu, engari e whakaatu ana i nga korero kaore e taea e nga parapara, penei i te tae me te whakatakotoranga ahu-toru.
translations.true_target_text: E kī ana tēnei i mau raukura ētahi mokoweri, he ariā e whakaponotia whānuitia ana, engari he kōrero e mau ana ka kore nei e kitea ki runga anga pōhatu, pērā ki te tae, me te tōna hanga ahu tengi nei.

translations.source_text: . Scientists say this animal's plumage was chestnut-brown on top with a pale or carotenoid-colored underside.
translations.pred_target_text: . E ai ki nga kaiputaiao, ko te huruhuru o tenei kararehe he maaka-parauri o runga, he koma, he karotenoid ranei te taha o raro.
translations.true_target_text: e kī nei ngā kaipūtaiao ko ngā huruhuru o tēnei kararehe he parauri o runga, ā, he kōmā, he ārani o raro.

translations.source_text: The find also grants insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.
translations.pred_target_text: Ma te kitenga ano he maarama ki te whanaketanga o nga huruhuru o nga manu.
translations.true_target_text: Mā tēnei kitenga e kite ai te māramatanga ki te kukuwhatanga o ngā raukura manu.

translations.source_text: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features.
translations.pred_target_text: Na te mea karekau he rakau i tino whanakehia e nga huruhuru mokoweri, e kiia nei he rachis, engari he ahua ke atu ano o te huruhuru - he paera me te paera - i kii nga kairangahau ko te rachis te whanaketanga o muri mai o enei ahuatanga.
translations.true_target_text: I te mea kāore ngā huruhuru tainahora i te whanake pai i te tuara, e kī ana ko te rachis, ēngari kāore he āhuatanga kē atu o te huruhuru - ko ngā niwha me ngā barbules - e kī ana ngā kairangahau kāore e kore ko te rachis tētahi mea i kukuwha ake i muri ake i ēnei atu āhuatanga.

translations.source_text: The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.
translations.pred_target_text: E ai ki te hanga o nga huruhuru kaore i whakamahia i roto i te rere, engari mo te whakarite i te pāmahana me te whakaatu. I kii nga kairangahau, ahakoa ko te hiku tenei o te mokoweri kuao, ko te tauira e whakaatu ana i te huruhuru o te pakeke, ehara i te mea he pi.
translations.true_target_text: E ai ki te hanganga o ngā huru kāore i whakamahia kia rere, engari kē mō te whakahaere paemahana, te whakaaturanga rānei. I marohi ngā kairangahau, ahakoa koinei te whiore o tētahi kūao mokonui, kei te kitea ki te tauira ngā huruhuru pakeke, kaua ko ngā huruhuru pīpī.

translations.source_text: The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.
translations.pred_target_text: I kii nga kairangahau, ahakoa ko te hiku tenei o te mokoweri kuao, ko te tauira e whakaatu ana i te huruhuru o te pakeke, ehara i te mea he pi.
translations.true_target_text: I marohitia e ngā kairangahau, ahakoa koinei te whiore o tētahi mokonui punua, kei te whakaaturia e te tauira ngā huruhuru o te pakeke, kaua ko te pīpī.

translations.source_text: A car bomb detonated at police headquarters in Gaziantep, Turkey yesterday morning killed two police officers and injured more than twenty other people.
translations.pred_target_text: He poma motoka i pupuhihia i te tari matua o nga pirihimana i Gaziantep, Turkey i te ata inanahi nei i mate nga pirihimana e rua, a, neke atu i te rua tekau nga tangata i whara.
translations.true_target_text: I pahū mai tētahi pōmu waka ki te wharenui o ngā pirhimana ki Gaziantep Tākei i te ata o nanahi. Ka mate ngā pirihimana e rua, ka neke atu i te rua tekau anō i whara.

translations.source_text: The governor's office said nineteen of the injured were police officers.

translations.source_text: Police said they suspect an alleged Daesh (ISIL) militant of responsibility for the attack.

translations.true_target_text: E whakapae ana ngā pirihimana ko te tangata tūkino he hōia Daesh (ISIL).

translations.source_text: They found the Sun operated on the same basic principles as other stars: The activity of all stars in the system was found to be driven by their luminosity, their rotation, and nothing else.
translations.pred_target_text: I kitea e ratou te mahi o te Ra i runga i nga tikanga taketake rite ki era atu whetu: Ko te mahi o nga whetu katoa i roto i te punaha i kitea na to ratou kanapa, to ratou hurihanga, kaore he mea ke atu.
translations.true_target_text: I kite ai rātou e ōrite ana ngā mātāpono o te Rā ki ētahi atu whetū: Nā te whērikoriko o ngā whetū katoa o te kāhui whetū, ō rātou huringa hoki.

translations.source_text: The luminosity and rotation are used together to determine a star's Rossby number, which is related to plasma flow.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakamahia ngatahi te kanapa me te hurihanga hei whakatau i te nama Rossby o te whetu, e pa ana ki te rere plasma.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te whakamahia tahitia te kanapā me te huringa hei whakatau i te tau Rossby a tētahi tau, ā, e hāngai ana tērā ki te rere wētoto.

translations.source_text: The smaller the Rossby number, the less active the star with respect to magnetic reversals.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te iti ake o te nama Rossby, ka iti ake te kaha o te whetu e pa ana ki nga hurihanga autō.
translations.true_target_text: Te iti iho o te nama Rossby, ka ngoikore ake te whetū mō te āhuatanga ki te hurihanga aukume.

translations.source_text: During his trip, Iwasaki ran into trouble on many occasions.

translations.source_text: The 802.11n standard operates on both the 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz frequencies.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te paerewa 802.11n e mahi ana i runga i nga iarere 2.4Ghz me te 5.0Ghz.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te paerewa 802.11n ka kōkiritia mā runga i te iarere 2.4Ghz me te 5.0Ghz

translations.source_text: This will allow it to be backwards compatible with 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g, provided that the base station has dual radios.
translations.pred_target_text: Ma tenei ka taea te whakamuri ki te 802.11a, 802.11b me 802.11g, mena he rua nga reo irirangi o te teihana turanga.
translations.true_target_text: Mā tēnei ka muri hototahi i te 802.11a, te 802.11b me te 802.11g, i runga i te āhuatanga e whai irirangi takirua ana te teihana.

translations.source_text: The speeds of 802.11n are substantially faster than that of its predecessors with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga tere o te 802.11n he tino tere ake i tera o mua me te nui o te 600Mbit/s.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā tere o te 802.11n he tino tere ake i tērā o ngā mea o mua ko tā rātou putanga ariā nui rawa ko te 600Mbit/s.

translations.source_text: Duvall, who is married with two adult children, did not leave a big impression on Miller, to whom the story was related.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko Duvall, kua marenatia me nga tamariki pakeke e rua, kaore i waiho he whakaaro nui ki a Miller, nana i korero te korero.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore a Duvall, kua mārenatia me ngā tamaiti pakeke e rua i waiho i tētahi whakaaro nui mō Miller, mō te take o tēnei kōrero.

translations.source_text: When asked for comment, Miller said, "Mike talks a lot during the hearing...I was getting ready so I wasn't really hearing what he was saying."
translations.pred_target_text: I te patainga mo nga korero, ka kii a Miller, "He maha nga korero a Mike i te wa o te whakawakanga...Kei te takatu ahau no reira kaore au i te tino rongo i ana korero."
translations.true_target_text: Ka pātaia, ko tā Miller, "he ngutu hohoro a Mike i ngā wā o te whakawātanga... i te whakatika au i a au anō, kāore au i rongo i a ia.

translations.source_text: "We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level," Hu said.
translations.pred_target_text: "Ka whakapau kaha matou ki te tapahi i nga tukunga waro hauhaa mo ia waeine o te GDP na roto i te 2020 mai i te taumata 2005," ko ta Hu.
translations.true_target_text: "Ka ngana tātou kia haukoti i te putanga waro hāora-rua ki ia waeine o te GDP ki tētahi rahinga nui, i mua i te tau 2020 mai i te taumata o te tau 2005," te kī a Hu.

translations.source_text: He did not set a figure for the cuts, saying they will be made based on China's economic output.
translations.pred_target_text: Kaore ia i whakatakoto he nama mo nga tapahi, e kii ana ka mahia i runga i nga hua ohaoha a Haina.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore ia i whakarite i ētahi nama mō ngā tapatapahi, e kī ana ka whakaritea i runga i te tāputa o te ohaoha o Haina.

translations.source_text: Hu encouraged developing countries "to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."
translations.pred_target_text: I akiaki a Hu i nga whenua whakawhanake "kia karo i te huarahi tawhito o te whakapoke i te tuatahi me te horoi i muri mai."
translations.true_target_text: I akiaki a Hu i ngā whenua e whanake ana "kia āraia te huarahi o mua o te parakino i te tuatahi, me te whakapai i muri iho ."

translations.source_text: He added that "they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities."
translations.pred_target_text: I kii ano ia "kaore e tika kia tonohia ki te kawe i nga herenga kei tua atu i o raatau whanaketanga, kawenga me o raatau kaha."
translations.true_target_text: Nāna i tāpiri "heoi anō, me kaua rātou e tonoa kia hiki i ngā kawenga kei tua atu i tā rātou wā whakawhanaketanga, haepapa, āheinga hoki."

translations.source_text: The Iraq Study Group presented its report at 12.00 GMT today.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakaatuhia e te Roopu Akoranga a Iraq tana purongo i te 12.00 GMT i tenei ra.
translations.true_target_text: I tukuna e te Iraq Study Group tāna pūrongo i te 12.00 GMT i tēnei rā.

translations.source_text: It warns No one can guarantee that any course of action in Iraq at this point will stop sectarian warfare, growing violence, or a slide toward chaos.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakatupatohia Kaore he tangata e kaha ki te kii ko nga mahi katoa i Iraq i tenei wa ka mutu te whawhai a te roopu, te tipu haere o te tutu, te paheketanga ranei ki te ngangau.
translations.true_target_text: He whakatūpato, kāore tētahi e āhei te kī ake mā tētahi mahinga ahakoa te aha e whakatū i te whawhai whakahāweatanga, i ngā kinonga e tupu tonu ana, i te tutūnga o te pūehu rānei ki Irāki.

translations.source_text: The Report opens with plea for open debate and the formation of a consensus in the United States about the policy towards the Middle East.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka tuwhera te Ripoata me te tohe mo te tautohetohe tuwhera me te hanga i tetahi whakaaro i roto i te United States mo te kaupapa here ki te Middle East.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tīmata te Rīpoata ki te inoi mō tētahi tautohetohe tūmatawhānui me te whakaritenga o tētahi whakaaetanga ki Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika mō te kaupapa here ki te Waenga o te Rāwhiti.

translations.source_text: The Report is highly critical of almost every aspect of the present policy of the Executive towards Iraq and it urges an immediate change of direction.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te Ripoata e tino whakahee ana mo nga ahuatanga katoa o te kaupapa here a te Kaiwhakahaere o naianei ki a Iraki, me te akiaki i te whakarereketanga o te huarahi.
translations.true_target_text: E aro nui ana te rīpoata ki ngā āhuatanga katoa kei te kaupapa here mō te kāhui whakahaere ki a Irāki, ā, e whakatenatena hoki i tētahi tirohanga hou.

translations.source_text: First among its 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic initiative should be taken before the end of this year to secure Iraq’s borders against hostile interventions and to re-establish diplomatic relations with its neighbors.
translations.pred_target_text: Tuatahi i roto i ana taunakitanga 78 me whai kaupapa hou mo te takawaenga i mua i te mutunga o tenei tau hei whakapumau i nga rohe o Iraki ki nga wawaotanga kino, me te whakatu ano i nga hononga takawaenga me ona hoa tata.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te tuatahi o ngā kupu taunaki e 78 kia puta he kaupapa hou i mua i te paunga o tēnei tau e tau ai ngā roherohenga whenua o Īraki hei ārai atu i te hunga urutomo mai, me te whakatū mai anō i ngā hononga i waenganui i ngā hoa piripono.

translations.source_text: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te kaitoha o naianei me te Wahine Tuatahi o Argentina a Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner i whakapuaki i tana tuunga perehitini i te ahiahi inanahi i La Plata, he taone e 50 kiromita (31 maero) te tawhiti atu i Buenos Aires.
translations.true_target_text: I te pō ō nanahi nei whakatauria ai e te kainganga ture ō nāianei, te Māreikura hoki o Argentina, a First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner ōna tūmanakotanga mō te perehitini ki La Plata, he taone 50 kiromita (31 maero) nei te tawhiti atu i Buenos Aires.

translations.source_text: Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakapuaki a Mrs Kirchner i tana hiahia ki te rere mo te perehitini i te Whare Tapere o Argentine, ko te waahi ano i timata ai ia ki te timata i tana pakanga mo te Senate i te tau 2005 hei mema mo te roopu porowini o Buenos Aires.
translations.true_target_text: I whakapuaki a Mrs. Kirchner i tana takune ki te tono i te tūranga perehitene ki te Argentine Theatre, arā ko te wāhi i whakamahia e ia hei tīmata i tana tautohe i te tau 2005 mō te Senate hei mema o te apatono ā-takiwā o Buenos Aires.

translations.source_text: The debate was sparked by controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction in the wake Hurricane Katrina; which some fiscal conservatives have humorously labeled "Bush's New Orleans Deal."
translations.pred_target_text: I puta te tautohetohe i te tautohetohe mo te whakapaunga moni mo te whakaora me te hanga ano i te oho o te Hurricane Katrina; i tapaina whakakatakatahia e etahi o nga kaipupuri moni ko "Bush's New Orleans Deal."
translations.true_target_text: I whakakāngia te tautohe e te whawhai mō te utu ki te whakamāmā me te hanganga anō whai muri i Hurricane Katrina; arā he whakatoi te tapa a ētahi ringa poto i tērā hei "Bush's New Orleans Deal."

translations.source_text: Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort has focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to perceived Washington insiders.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga whakahē a Rīpera mo te mahi hanga hou kua aro ki te whakawhiwhinga o nga kirimana hangahanga ki te hunga mohio o Washington.
translations.true_target_text: Kua aro atu ngā kōrero whakahē huhua o te mahi hanga anō ki te tuku i ngā kirimana hanga anō ki te hunga e whakaarohia ana he hoa nō roto o Washington.

translations.source_text: Over four million people went to Rome to attend the funeral.
translations.pred_target_text: Neke atu i te wha miriona nga tangata i haere ki Roma ki te tangihanga.
translations.true_target_text: Neke atu i te whā miriona tāngata i haere ki Rōma hei tae atu ki te tangi.

translations.source_text: The number of people present was so large that it was not possible for everybody to gain access to the funeral in St. Peter's Square.
translations.pred_target_text: He nui rawa te tokomaha o te hunga i tae atu, kaore i taea e te katoa te uru atu ki te tangihanga i te tapawha o Hato Pita.
translations.true_target_text: I pērā rawa te tini o ngā tāngata i tae mai kāore i taea e te katoa te tangihanga nei ki St. Pita Tapawhā te tomo.

translations.source_text: Several large television screens were installed in various places in Rome to let the people watch the ceremony.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga pouaka whakaata nui i utaina ki nga waahi rereke i Roma hei tuku i nga tangata ki te matakitaki i te hui.
translations.true_target_text: Ka whakatūria ētahi mata pouaka whakaata rahi ki ētahi wāhi ki Rōma kia āhei te tangata te mātakitaki i te hui.

translations.source_text: In many other cities of Italy and in the rest of the world, particularly in Poland, similar setups were made, which were viewed by a great number of people.
translations.pred_target_text: I etahi atu taone nui o Itari me era atu o te ao, otira ki Poroni, i mahia he ahua rite, i tirohia e te tini o nga tangata.
translations.true_target_text: Ki ngā tāone nui kē atu o Itari, ki te toenga o te ao anō hoki, inarā ki Pōrana, i whakaritea pēnei hoki ngā hanganga, ā, i mātakitakihia e te tini o ngā tāngata.

translations.source_text: Historians have criticized past FBI policies for focusing resources on cases which are easy to solve, especially stolen car cases, with the intent of boosting the agency's success rate.

translations.true_target_text: Kua whakakoha ngā tumu kōrero i ngā kaupapa here o mua o te FBI mō te tuku i ngā rawa ki ngā kēhi he māmā te whakaoti, inarā ko ngā kēhi waka tāhae, me te whāinga o te whakahiki i te pāpātanga angitu o te umanga.

translations.source_text: Congress began funding the obscenity initiative in fiscal 2005 and specified that the FBI must devote 10 agents to adult pornography.

translations.source_text: Robin Uthappa made the innings highest score, 70 runs in just 41 balls by hitting 11 fours and 2 sixes.
translations.pred_target_text: I eke a Robin Uthappa ki te piro teitei rawa atu, 70 oma i roto i te 41 noa nga poi na te 11 nga wha me te 2 ono.

translations.source_text: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, performed well and made a hundred-run partnership.
translations.pred_target_text: He pai te mahi a nga kaikopere o waenga, a Sachin Tendulkar me Rahul Dravid, me te mahi tahi rau-rere.
translations.true_target_text: I tino pai te tākaro a ngā kaipatu pōro ō waenganui, a Sachin Tendulkar rāua ko Rahul David, ā, kotahi rau ā rāua piro.

translations.source_text: But, after losing the captain's wicket India only made 36 runs loosing 7 wickets to end the innings.

translations.source_text: U.S. President George W. Bush arrived in Singapore the morning of November 16, beginning a week-long tour of Asia.
translations.pred_target_text: I tae mai te Perehitini o Amerika a George W. Bush ki Singapore i te ata o te 16 o Noema, ka timata te haerenga mo te wiki ki Ahia.
translations.true_target_text: I tae atu a President George W. Bush o Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika ki Hingapoa i te ata o te rā 6 o Noema, i reira i tīmata tētahi haerenga kotahi wiki te roa o Āhia.

translations.source_text: He was greeted by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng and discussed trade and terrorism issues with the Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.
translations.pred_target_text: I ohaina ia e te Pirimia Tuarua o Singapore Wong Kan Seng me te korero mo nga take hokohoko me nga mahi whakatumatuma me te Pirimia o Singapore Lee Hsien Loong.
translations.true_target_text: I mihia ia e te Pirimia Tuarua o Hingapoa a Wong Kan Seng, ā, i wānanga i te hokohoko me ngā take whakatuatea ki te Pirimia o Hingapoa a Lee Hsien Loong.

translations.source_text: After a week of losses in the midterm election, Bush told an audience about the expansion of trade in Asia.
translations.pred_target_text: I muri i te wiki o te ngaronga i te pooti o te tau waenga, ka korero a Bush ki te hunga whakarongo mo te toronga o te hokohoko ki Ahia.
translations.true_target_text: Whai muri i te kotahi wiki o ngā hinganga ki te kōwhiringa pōti waenga wā, nā Bush i whaki atu ki tētahi minenga mō te whakawhānuitanga o te hokohoko ki Āhia.

translations.source_text: Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO.
translations.pred_target_text: Kua whakaae te Pirimia a Stephen Harper ki te tuku i te 'Clean Air Act' a te kawanatanga ki tetahi komiti a nga roopu katoa mo te arotake, i mua i tana panui tuarua, i muri i te hui 25 meneti o te Turei me te rangatira o te NDP a Jack Layton i te PMO.
translations.true_target_text: Kua whakaae te Pirimia a Stephen Harper ki te tuku i te "Clean Air Act" o te kāwanatanga ki tētahi komiti pāti-katoa hei arotake, i mua i tana pānuitanga tuarua, ā muri i te hui 25 meneti te roa i te Tūrei ki te kaiārahi NPD a Jack Layton ki te PMO.

translations.source_text: Layton had asked for changes to the conservatives' environmental bill during the meeting with the PM, asking for a "thorough and complete rewriting" of the Conservative party's environmental bill.
translations.pred_target_text: I tono a Layton mo nga whakarereketanga ki te pire taiao a nga Kaitoi i te wa o te hui me te Pirimia, me te tono kia "tuhi ano kia tino tika" te pire taiao a te roopu Conservative.
translations.true_target_text: Kua tono a Layton ki ngā panoni ki te pire taiao o ngā conservatives i te hui ki te Pirimia, i te tono ki tētahi "tuhinga anō he ngaio, he tukupū" o te piri taiao o te pāti Conservative.

translations.source_text: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.
translations.pred_target_text: Mai i te wa i uru mai ai te Kawanatanga a te Federal ki te tango i nga putea mo te hohipera Mersey i Devonport, Tasmania, kua whakahee te kawanatanga me etahi o nga mema paremata o te kawanatanga i tenei mahi he mea whakakorikori i te timatanga o te pooti a te kawanatanga ka karangahia hei te marama o Noema.
translations.true_target_text: Mai rā anō i te tūnga mai o te Kāwanatanga Aka Haumi ki te whakahaere i ngā pūtea o te hōhipera Mersey ki Devonport, Tasmania, kua whakahēngia tēnei mahi e te kāwanatanga ā-motu, e ētahi Mema Pāremata aka haumi hei whakangaio i te aranga atu ki te pōtitanga aka haumi me karanga ā te marama o Noema, ā mua rānei.

translations.source_text: But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million.
translations.pred_target_text: Engari ko te korero a te Pirimia a John Howard ko te mahi he tiaki noa i nga whare o te hohipera kei whakahekehia e te kawanatanga o Tasmania, na roto i te tuku taapiri $45 miriona.
translations.true_target_text: Engari, hei tā te Pirimia, tā John Howard, ko te kaupapa o te pire he manaaki i ngā hohipera kia kore ai ō rātou mana e takahia e te Kāwanatanga o Tāhimana, ka whakawhiwhia ki te AUD$45 miriona.

translations.source_text: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue.
translations.pred_target_text: E ai ki nga panui hou, ko nga panui o te taumata o te moana e tohu ana i puta he tai tainiwhaniwha. I kitea etahi mahi tainiwhaniwha i hopukina tata ki Pago Pago me Niue.
translations.true_target_text: E ai ki te pānui hou, ko ngā karere e kī ana mō te pikinga o te moana i rewa ake tētahi tsunami. I rikoata tika i te mahinga tsunami pā tata atu ki pago pago me Niue.

translations.source_text: No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC.
translations.pred_target_text: Karekau he kino, he wharanga nui ranei i korerohia ki Tonga, engari i ngaro te hiko mo te wa poto, e ai ki nga korero i kore ai nga mana whakahaere o Tonga e whiwhi i te whakatupato ngaru i tukuna e te PTWC.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore he kinonga nui, he whara rānei i rīpoatangia ki Tonga, heoi i ngaro te hiko, ā, nā tenei i ngaro hoki te kaha kia rongo ai i te ohoreretanga mai i te PTWC e pā ana ki te tsunami.

translations.source_text: Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

translations.source_text: U.S. President George W. Bush welcomed the announcement.

translations.source_text: Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge "a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."

translations.source_text: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te awha whakatekau o te wa o te Hurricane Atlantic, ko Subtropical Storm Jerry, i hanga ki te Moana Atalani i tenei ra.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te ingoa o te āwha tuangāhuru ki te whai ingoa o te kaupeka haumātakataka o Atlantic, arā ko Subtropical Storm Jerry, i rewa ake ki te Atlantic Ocean i te rā nei.

translations.source_text: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) says that at this point Jerry poses no threat to land.
translations.pred_target_text: E ai ki te National Hurricane Center (NHC) i tenei wa kaore a Jerry e whakatuma ki te whenua.

translations.source_text: The U.S. Corps of Engineers estimated that 6 inches of rainfall could breach the previously damaged levees.

translations.true_target_text: Kei te whakatau tata ngā U.S. Corps of Engineers ko te 6 īnihi o te hekenga ua ka wāwāhi pea i ngā maioro kua pakaru kē.

translations.source_text: The Ninth Ward, which saw flooding as high as 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently in waist-high water as the nearby levee was overtopped.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te Waari Tuaiwa, i kite i te waipuke ki te 20 putu te teitei i te Hurricane Katrina, kei roto i te wai teitei o te hope i te mea kua eke te pari tata.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te Ninth Ward, i reira i waipuketia tae atu ki te 20 putu te teitei i te wā o Hurricane Katrina, kei te noho ki raro i te wai he hope te teitei i te ekenga o te maioro oneone tata.

translations.source_text: Water is spilling over the levee in a section 100 feet wide.

translations.true_target_text: Kei te maringi te wai i te maioro ki tētahi wāhanga e 100 putu te whānui.

translations.source_text: Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his frustration over the deletions when he spoke to Wikinews last month.

translations.source_text: UN peacekeepers, whom arrived in Haiti after the 2010 earthquake, are being blamed for the spread of the disease which started near the troop's encampment.

translations.source_text: Murray lost the first set in a tie break after both men held each and every serve in the set.

translations.source_text: Potro received treatment to his shoulder at this point but managed to return to the game.

translations.source_text: At Thursday's keynote presentation of the Tokyo Game Show, Nintendo president Satoru Iwata unveiled the controller design for the company's new Nintendo Revolution console.

translations.source_text: Resembling a television remote, the controller uses two sensors placed near the user's television to triangulate its position in three-dimensional space.

translations.source_text: This will allow players to control actions and movements in video games by moving the device through the air.

translations.source_text: "She’s very cute and sings quite well, too," he said according to a transcript of the news conference.

translations.source_text: "I was moved every time we did a rehearsal on this, from the bottom of my heart."

translations.source_text: Five minutes into the display a wind starts rolling in, about a minute later, the wind is reaching 70km/h... then the rain comes, but so hard and so large that it slaps your skin like a needle, then hail fell from the sky, people panicking and screaming and running over each other.

Kātahi ka tae mai te ua, engari ka pērā rawa te kaha, te rahi ka patua te kiri pērā i te ngira, kātahi ka rere te hukawaitara i te rangi, ka maurirere te hunga, ka tioro, ka takahi tētahi i tētahi.

translations.source_text: It is reported that some 9400 homes in the region are without water and approximately 100 without electricity.

translations.source_text: Some roads have been damaged, railway service interrupted in the affected areas, and the Noto Airport in Ishikawa prefecture remains closed.

translations.source_text: One bomb exploded outside the governor general's office.

translations.source_text: Both cyanuric acid and melamine were found in urine samples from pets that died after consuming contaminated pet food.

translations.source_text: The two compounds react with one another to form crystals that may block kidney function, researchers at the university said.

translations.source_text: The researchers observed crystals formed in cat urine by the addition of melamine and cyanuric acid.

translations.source_text: I don't know if you realize it or not, but most of the goods from Central America came into this country duty-free.

translations.source_text: Yet eighty percent of our goods were taxed through tariffs in Central American countries. we treat you.

translations.source_text: That didn't seem to make sense to me; it certainly wasn't fair.

translations.source_text: All I say to people is you treat us the way we treat you.

translations.source_text: California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed into law a bill that bans the sale or rental of violent video games to minors.

translations.source_text: The bill requires violent video games sold in the state of California to be labeled with a decal reading "18" and makes their sale to a minor punishable by a fine of $1000 per offense.

translations.source_text: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Kier Starmer QC, gave a statement this morning announcing the prosecution of both Huhne and Pryce.

translations.source_text: Huhne has resigned and he will be replaced in the Cabinet by Ed Davey MP. Norman Lamb MP is expected to take the Business Minister job Davey is vacating.

translations.source_text: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.

translations.source_text: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.

translations.source_text: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.

translations.source_text: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

translations.source_text: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.

translations.source_text: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.

translations.source_text: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.

translations.source_text: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

translations.source_text: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.

translations.source_text: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
translations.pred_target_text: Kotahi ki te toru nga tane pakeke e hono ana, me te toru tekau nga wahine me nga kuao.

translations.source_text: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.

translations.source_text: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
translations.pred_target_text: He rite tonu te mahi a te Raiona ki nga roopu wuruhi, kuri ranei, he rite tonu nga kararehe ki te raiona (engari ehara i etahi atu ngeru nui) te whanonga, he tino whakamate hoki ki a ratou kai.
translations.true_target_text: Ka āhua pērā te mahi a ngā rōpū raiona i ngā rōpū wuruhi, kurī rānei, he kararehe he ohorere tana ōrite ki ngā raiona (engari kaua ki ērā atu ngeru nui) mō te whanonga, ā, he tino whakamate ki ngā kararehe ka patua e rātou.

translations.source_text: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.

translations.source_text: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te taika kei roto i te roopu kotahi (Genus Panthera) me te raiona, te reparo, me te jaguars. Ko enei ngeru e wha anake ka haruru.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te roopu ōrite ki te raiona, ki te rēpara me ngā hākua te tāika. Ko ēnei ngeru tokowhā anake ngā ngeru e āhei ana te horu.

translations.source_text: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te haruru o te taika ehara i te rite ki te hamama o te raiona, engari he rite tonu ki te rerenga korero o te ngangau, nga kupu hamama.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te haruru a te taika ehara i te mea he haruru nui pērā ki te raiona, engari he momo ngengere, he momo tīwahawaha.

translations.source_text: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
translations.pred_target_text: He pai ki a Ocelots te kai kararehe iti. Ka hopu makimaki, nakahi, kiore me nga manu mena ka taea. Tata ki te katoa o nga kararehe e whaia ana e te ocelot he iti ake i tera.
translations.true_target_text: Pai ki ngā ocelots te kai i ngā kararehe iti. Ka hopu i a rātou ngā makimaki, ngā nākahi, ngā rīroi me ngā manu mēnā e taea ana. Ko te nuinga o ngā kararehe e aru nei ngā ocelot he iti rawa iho i a ia.

translations.source_text: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
translations.pred_target_text: E whakaaro ana nga kaiputaiao ka whai nga ocelots ka kimi kararehe hei kai (para) ma te hongi, e hongi ana ki te waahi i noho ai ratou ki te whenua.
translations.true_target_text: E whakaaro ana ngā kaimātai pūtaiao mā te hongi e rapu ai te ocelot i āna kai, e whai ai ia ki hea rā i te whenua ōna kai e haere ana.

translations.source_text: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea e ratou te kite tino pai i roto i te pouri me te kite i te po, me te neke puku, hoki. Ka whaiwhai nga Ocelots i a ratou kai ma te whakakotahi ki o ratou taiao katahi ka paopao ki a ratou kai.
translations.true_target_text: He rawe ō rātou karu ki te titiro i roto i te pō uriuri me ngā tirohanga o te pō, me te āta nekeneke hoki. Ka aru te Ocelot i ana kai ,ā te whakaranu me ōna taiao, ā, kua kotahi atu ki tana kai.

translations.source_text: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
translations.pred_target_text: Ina wehe mai he roopu iti o nga mea ora (he iti te taupori) mai i te taupori matua i ahu mai ai ratou (penei me te neke i runga i te pae maunga, i te awa ranei, mena ka neke ki te motu hou kia kore ai e ngawari. neke whakamuri) ka kitea he waahi rereke i to ratau i mua.
translations.true_target_text: I te wā e wehe ai tētahi roopū iti o ētahi mea ora (he rahinga iti) i tētahi rahinga nui i ahu mai ai rātou (pēnā me i neke ake i ētahi pae māunga i tētahi awa rānei, me i nuku rānei ki tētahi motu e uaua ai te hokinga mai) i te nuinga o te wā ka tau ki tētahi taiao rerekē ki tā rātou i mōhio ai.

translations.source_text: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
translations.pred_target_text: He rereke nga rauemi me nga momo whakataetae o tenei taiao hou, na reira ka hiahia te taupori hou ki nga ahuatanga rereke, ki nga whakarereketanga ranei kia kaha ai te whakataetae atu i nga mea i hiahiatia e ratou i mua.
translations.true_target_text: Kei tēnei taiao hou he rauemi rerekē, he kaiwhakataetae rerekē, nō reira me whai te taupori hou i ngā āhuatanga rerekē, i ngā urutaunga rerekē rānei kia noho hei kaiwhakataetae kaha i ērā i te hiahiatia i mua.

translations.source_text: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te taupori taketake kaore rawa i rereke, kei te hiahia tonu ratau ki nga whakarereketanga o mua.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore anō te taupori tāngata kia paku tīni, me whai tonu i ngā urutaunga o mua.

translations.source_text: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
translations.pred_target_text: I te wa o te wa, ka timata te taupori hou ki te urutau ki o raatau taiao hou, ka iti ake te ahua o te taupori.
translations.true_target_text: Nāwai rā, i te tīmatanga o te taupori te urutau ki tō rātou taupori hou, ka iti haere tō rātou āhua i tērā atu taupori.

translations.source_text: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
translations.pred_target_text: I te mutunga iho, i muri i te mano, tae noa ki nga miriona tau, ka rereke te ahua o nga taupori e rua, kaore e taea te kiia he momo momo.
translations.true_target_text: Tāria te wā, ā muri i ngā tini mano tau, tini miriona tau rānei pea, ka pērā te rerekē o te āhua o ngā taupori e rua e kore e taea te kīia kotahi tonu te momo.

translations.source_text: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka kiia e matou tenei tukanga he speciation, ko te tikanga ko te hanga momo hou. Ko te whakakitenga he hua kaore e taea te karo me tetahi waahanga nui o te kukuwhatanga.
translations.true_target_text: Ka karangahia tēnei āhuatanga koiora, e kī ana ko te tikanga noa ko te hanganga o tētahi koiora hou. Kāore e taea te aha mō te taha ki te koiora, ā, he wāhanga tīno hirahira tēnei o te kukuwhatanga.

translations.source_text: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
translations.pred_target_text: Hangaia e te tipu te hāora e haua ana e te tangata, ka tango i te waro-hauora ka hoha e te tangata (ara te manawa ki waho).
translations.true_target_text: Ka hangaia e te tipu te hāora ka hāngia e te tangata, ā, ka hā ki roto te tipu i te hauhā ka puta i te tangata (arā, ka hā ki waho).

translations.source_text: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka mahia e nga tipu a ratou kai mai i te ra ma te whakaahua. Ka whakarato hoki ratou i te whakamarumaru.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te hangaia e ngā tipu ā rātou ake kai mai i te rā ki te ahotakakame. Kei te tuku hoki rātou i te marumaru.

translations.source_text: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
translations.pred_target_text: Hangaia o tatou whare mai i nga tipu ka hanga kakahu mai i nga tipu. Ko te nuinga o nga kai ka kainga e tatou he tipu. Ki te kore he tipu, kare e ora nga kararehe.
translations.true_target_text: Ka hangaia ō mātou whare me ngā kākahu i ngā hua tipu. Ko te nuinga o ā māua/mātou kai he hua tipu. Ki te kore ngā hua tipu e kore ngā kararehe e ora.

translations.source_text: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko Mosasaurus te tino kaipahua o tona wa, no reira kaore ia i mataku, engari ko etahi atu mosasaurs.
translations.true_target_text: Ko Mosasaurus te konihi matua o tōna wā, nō reira kāore i mataku ki tētahi, atu i ērā atu mosasaurs.

translations.source_text: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
translations.pred_target_text: Neke atu i te 70 nga niho koi o ona kauae roa, me tetahi atu huinga ki te tuanui o tona waha, te tikanga karekau he mawhiti mo tetahi mea e whiti ana i tona huarahi.
translations.true_target_text: Kei ōna kauae roa te nui atu i te 70 ngā niho tino koi, tae atu ki tētahi huinga niho anō ki te ngao, nō reira e kore e taea te pahiko e tētahi mea ka tutaki ki a ia.

translations.source_text: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
translations.pred_target_text: Kaore matou i te tino mohio, engari he mawhatu te arero. Ko tana kai ko te honu, te ika nui, etahi atu mosasaurs, a tera pea he kai tangata.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore mātou i te tino mōhio, heoi anō, kei kīa he arero marara tōna. Ko ōna kai he honu, he ika nui, he mokoweri, he kaikiko tonu hoki.

translations.source_text: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakaekea ano e ia nga mea katoa i uru ki roto ki te wai; ahakoa ko te mokoweri nui penei i a T. rex karekau e rite.
translations.true_target_text: I tuki hoki ia i ngā mea katoa ka kuhu ki te wai; kāore hoki tētahi mokonui rahi pērā i te T. rex i te āhei ki te whawhai ki a ia.

translations.source_text: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa ko te nuinga o a ratou kai e mohio ana ki a matou, ko nga tangata o Roma he momo hakari rereke, rereke ranei, tae atu ki te poaka mohoao, te pikake, nga ngata, me tetahi momo kiore e kiia nei he dormouse.
translations.true_target_text: Ahakoa ka mōhio tātou ki te nuinga o ā rātou kai, i ngā Rōmana anō hoki ētahi kai hākari rerekē, whanokē, tae atu ki te poaka puihi, te pīkake, ngā ngata, me tētahi momo kiore e kīia nei he dormouse

translations.source_text: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tetahi atu rereke ko te mea i te wa e kai ana te hunga rawakore me te wahine i a ratou kai i runga i nga tuuru, ka pai nga tangata taonga ki te whai hakari tahi ki reira noho ai ki o ratou taha i a ratou e kai ana i a ratou kai.
translations.true_target_text: Ko tētahi atu rerekētanga ko tā te hunga pohara, te wahine anō hoki kai i ā rātou kai i te wā e noho ana ki ngā tūru, ko tā te tāne whai rawa he hākari tahi i a rātou e takoto ana ki ō rātou taha i a rātou e kai ana i ā rātou kai.

translations.source_text: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga kai o mua o Roma kaore i uru ki nga kai i tae mai ki Uropi mai i Amerika, mai i Ahia ranei i nga rautau o muri mai.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore i taea e ngā kai a ngā Rōmana Tawhito te whai i ngā kai i tae atu ki Ūropi i Amerika, i Āhia rānei i ngā rau tau i muri ake.

translations.source_text: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
translations.pred_target_text: Hei tauira, karekau he kanga, he tōmato, he rīwai, he koko, karekau hoki a Roma o mua i whakamatau i te korukoru.
translations.true_target_text: Hei tauira, karekau ā rātou kānga, tōmato, rīwai, kōkō rānei, ā, kāore te Rōma o mua i kai i te tākei.

translations.source_text: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
translations.pred_target_text: I hanga e nga Karakia o ratou atua he whare tapu tuatahi i kiia ko te kainga o te atua.
translations.true_target_text: I hangaia e ngā Babylon he temepara mō ia o ō rātou atua, ā, i whakapono koinaka tonu te kāinga o te atua raka.

translations.source_text: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka kawea e nga tangata he patunga tapu ki nga atua, ka ngana nga tohunga ki te whakatutuki i nga hiahia o nga atua ma nga huihuinga me nga hakari.
translations.true_target_text: I te kawe mai ngā tāngata i ngā whakahere ki ngā atua, ā, i ngana ngā pirihi ki te aro atu ki ngā hiahia o ngā atua mā ngā mahi whakanui, mā ngā hui ahurei hoki.

translations.source_text: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
translations.pred_target_text: Te vai ra te aua o te hiero i roto i te hiero tataitahi e te hoê vahi mo‘a i roto e te mau tahu‘a ana‘e te nehenehe e tomo.
translations.true_target_text: I ia temepara tētahi ātea temepara, ā, he whakamaurutanga ki roto ka taea anake e ngā pirihi te kuhu.

translations.source_text: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
translations.pred_target_text: I etahi wa ka hangaia nga pourewa motuhake, e kiia ana ko te ziggurats, hei waahanga o nga temepara.
translations.true_target_text: I ētahi wā ka hangaia he pourewa motuhake he kōeko te āhua, ko te ingoa ko ngā ziggurats, kia noho hei wāhanga o ngā temepara.

translations.source_text: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tihi o te pourewa he wahi tapu motuhake mo te atua.
translations.true_target_text: He wāhi motuhake te tihi o te pourewa mō te atua.

translations.source_text: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto i te rangi mahana o te Middle East, ehara i te mea tino nui te whare.
translations.true_target_text: I roto i te āhuarangi mahana o te Waenga Rāwhiti, kāore i tino hirahira te whare.

translations.source_text: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te nuinga o te oranga o te whanau Hiperu i puta i waho.
translations.true_target_text: Ko tā te oranga o te whānau Hīperu i waho kē.

translations.source_text: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka mahi nga wahine i te tunu kai i roto i te iari; he porotiti tuwhera noa nga toa e titiro ana ki te tiriti. I whakamahia te kohatu hei hanga whare.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā wāhine i tunu i roto i te iāri; ko ngā toa he taupaepae kua tuwhera noa e anga ana ki te tiriti. Ko te kōhatu i whakamahia kia hanga whare.

translations.source_text: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
translations.pred_target_text: Karekau he ngahere nunui i te whenua o Kanaana, no reira he tino utu nga rakau.
translations.true_target_text: Karekau he ngahere nunui i te whenua o Canaan, nō reira i tino nui ai te utu mō te rākau.

translations.source_text: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
translations.pred_target_text: He iti noa te noho a Greenland. I roto i nga korero a Norse e kii ana ratou i whakahekea a Erik te Whero mai i Tiorangi mo te kohuru, a, i te haerenga ki te hauauru, ka kitea e ia a Greenland ka tapaina ko Greenland.
translations.true_target_text: I tūruki noa te whakatau i te whenua o Greenland. Kei ngā kōrero mō Norse e kī ana i manenetia a Erik the Red mai i Iceland i ana mahi kōhuru, ā, nōna e e haere whaka-te-uru ana, i kitea ai e ia a Greenland, ka tapaina te whenua nei ko Greenland.

translations.source_text: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
translations.pred_target_text: Engari ahakoa te mea i kitea e ia, kua noho kee nga iwi Eskimo ki reira i tera wa.
translations.true_target_text: Ahakoa tāna huranga, i reira kē ngā iwi Eskimo e noho ana i taua wā.

translations.source_text: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa he 'Scandinavian' ia whenua, he maha nga rereketanga i waenganui i nga tangata, nga kingi, nga tikanga me nga hitori o Tenemaka, Sweden, Norewei me Tiorangi.
translations.true_target_text: Ahakoa he "Scandinavian" ia whenua, he nui ngā rerekētanga i waenganui i ngā tāngata, i ngā kīngi, i ngā tikanga, i ngā hītori o Tenemāka, o Huitene, o Nōwei, o Tiorangi.

translations.source_text: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
translations.pred_target_text: Mena kua matakitaki koe i te kiriata National Treasure, ka whakaaro pea koe he mapi taonga i tuhia ki muri o te Whakaputanga o te Rangatiratanga.
translations.true_target_text: Mēnā kua kite koe i te whakaaturanga National treasure, kei pōhēhē koe ka kitea he mapi tāonga ki runga i te Whakapuakanga o te Rangatiratanga.

translations.source_text: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
translations.pred_target_text: Heoi, ehara i te mea pono. Ahakoa he mea kua tuhia ki muri o te tuhinga, ehara i te mapi taonga.
translations.true_target_text: Heoi anō, ehara tērā i te pono. Ahakoa he tuhinga ki te taha whakamuri o te puka, ehara i te mahere taonga.

translations.source_text: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
translations.pred_target_text: I tuhia ki muri o te Whakaputanga o te Rangatiratanga ko nga kupu "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". Ka puta te kuputuhi ki raro o te tuhinga, ka huripoki ki raro.
translations.true_target_text: I tuhingia ki muri i te Whakapuakanga o te Rangatiratanga ko ngā kupu "te whakapuakanga tuatahi taketake mō te Rangatiratanga i te 4 o Hurae 1776". Ka kitea te tuhinga i raro o te tuhinga, e hurirapa ana.

translations.source_text: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa karekau he tangata tino mohio na wai i tuhi, e mohiotia ana i te timatanga o tona oranga, i whakatakahia te pepa kirikiri nui (29¾ inihi ki te 24½ inihi) hei rokiroki.
translations.true_target_text: He ahakoa kāore tētahi e mōhio pū nāwai i tuhi, e mōhio nei i te timatanga o tana oranga, te tuhinga pepa nui (ko tana nui ko te 29 3/4 inihi mā te 24 1/2 inihi) i rōrangia hei putunga.

translations.source_text: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
translations.pred_target_text: Na, ko te mea pea i taapirihia te tuhipoka hei tapanga noa.
translations.true_target_text: Nā, e tinga ana i tāpiritia noatia te tuhinga hei tapa.

translations.source_text: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga taunga D-Day me nga pakanga e whai ake nei i wetekina te raki o Parani, engari ko te tonga kaore ano kia waatea.
translations.true_target_text: Nā ngā tauranga D-Day me ngā pakanga i whai ake i wewete i te raki o Wīwī, engari kāore tonu te tonga i te wewete.

translations.source_text: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakahaeretia e te "Vichy" French. He iwi Wīwī ēnei i houhia te rongo ki ngā Tiamana i te tau 1940, ā, i mahi tahi me te hunga whakaeke, kaua ki te whawhai ki a rātou.
translations.true_target_text: I whakaturengia e te "Vichy" Wīwi. He tangata Wīwi ēnei i hou te rongo me ngā Tiamani i te 1940, ā, i mahi tahi me ngā kaiwhawhai tēnā i te whawhai i a rātou.

translations.source_text: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
translations.pred_target_text: I te 15 o Akuhata i te tau 1940, ka whakaekea e nga Hoia te tonga o Parani, ka kiia te whakaekenga ko "Operation Dragoon".
translations.true_target_text: I te rā 15 o Ākuhaga 1940, i eke ngā Allies ki te tonga o Wīwī, i kīia te ekenga ko "Operation Dragoon".

translations.source_text: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto noa i nga wiki e rua kua tukuna e nga Amelikana me nga hoia Free French te tonga o Parani, ka huri ki Tiamana.
translations.true_target_text: I roto i ngā wiki e rua noa i wetekina e ngā Amerikana me ngā hōia Wīwī Free French te tonga o Wīwī, ā, i te anga atu ki Tiamani.

translations.source_text: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te iwi he ahurea motuhake e noho tahi ana e te roopu nui o te iwi e noho tahi ana, e mahi tahi ana, he hapori.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te iwitanga he ahurea kotahi e whāia ana e tētahi rōpū motuhake nunui e noho ana e mahi tahi ana, he hapori.

translations.source_text: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te kupu civilization i ahu mai i te Latin civilis, te tikanga civil, e pa ana ki te Latin civis, te tikanga he tangata whenua, me te civitas, te tikanga o te taone, te taone-taone ranei, me te whakaatu ano i te rahi o te hapori.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te ahu mai te kupu civilization i te civilis no te reo Rātini, ko tōna tikanga ko te civil, e hāngai ana ki te kupu civis o Rātini, ko tōna tikanga ko te citizen, me te civitas, ko tōna tikanga ko te tāone nui, ko te takiwā tāone nui rānei, ā, ka pērā ka tautuhitia hoki te rahi o te papori.

translations.source_text: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga taone-whenua te timatanga o nga iwi. Ko te tikanga o te ahurea tuku iho he tukunga matauranga ki nga reanga maha, he tapuwae ahurea e mau tonu ana, me te tuku tika.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tū ngā rohe-tāone nui, kātahi ka puta mai ngā whenua. Ko tētahi āhuatanga o te ahurea whatutoto ko te tuku i te mātauranga whakawhiti atu i ētahi reanga, tētahi whakarerenga ā-ahurea e toe ana, ā, he tika te tukutuku atu.

translations.source_text: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

translations.true_target_text: Ka maninohea noa ngā ahurea iti nei, ka ngaro ngā kōrero tuku iho e mana ai te iwi hei iwi mananui.

translations.source_text: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
translations.pred_target_text: I te wa o te Pakanga Hurihuri, ko nga kawanatanga tekau ma toru i hanga tuatahi he kawanatanga ngoikore—ko te Runanga anake te waahanga—i raro i nga Tuhinga o te Kotahitanga.
translations.true_target_text: I te Revolutionary War, i hanga tuatahitia e ngā whenua tekau mā toru tētahi kāwanatanga ā-motu ngoikore - ā, ko te Congress tōna waehanga anake - ki raro i ngā Articles of Confederation.

translations.source_text: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
translations.pred_target_text: Karekau he mana o te Runanga ki te tuku taake, a, na te mea karekau he mana whakahaere o te motu, he kaiwhakawa ranei, ka whakawhirinaki ki nga mana whakahaere o te kawanatanga, he maha nga wa kaore i te mahi tahi, ki te whakamana i ana mahi katoa.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore i whai mana tō te kaunihera ki te whakatau tāke, nāreira, i te mea kāore he mana whakahaere motu he kaiwhakawā rānei, i whakawhirinaki atu ki te mana o te kāwanatanga kāore i pai ki te mahitahi hei whakamana i ana ture katoa.

translations.source_text: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
translations.pred_target_text: Kaore hoki he mana ki te whakakore i nga ture taake me nga utu i waenga i nga kawanatanga.
translations.true_target_text: Karekau hoki tōna mana kia takahi i ngā ture tāke me ngā tāka i waenganui i ngā whenua.

translations.source_text: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga Tuhinga ka hiahiatia he whakaaetanga kotahi mai i nga kawanatanga katoa i mua i te whakarereketanga me te ngawari o nga kawanatanga ki te kawanatanga o te pokapū i te nuinga o te wa ka ngaro o ratou mangai.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te hiahiatia e ngā Atikara te whakaaetanga a te katoa mai i ngā takiwā katoa i mua i te panoni, ā, ka pērā rawa te kore aronga o ngā takiwā ki te kāwanatanga ā-motu he nui ngā wā e matangaro ana ā rātou māngai.

translations.source_text: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.

translations.source_text: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.

translations.source_text: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

translations.source_text: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!

translations.true_target_text: Kei a Hapani ngā motu tata ki te 7,000 (ko te mea nui rawa ko Honshu), nā konei ko Hapani te motu tuawhitu te rahi rawa ki te ao!

translations.source_text: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"

translations.source_text: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
translations.pred_target_text: I timata mai a Taiwan i te rautau 1500 i reira nga heramana Pakeha e haere ana ma te tuhi i te ingoa o te motu ko Ilha Formosa, he motu ataahua ranei.
translations.true_target_text: I Taiwana i tīmata i ngā wā o mua i te rautau 15 i te tuhinga a ngā hēramana Ūropi e whakawhiti ana i te motu ko Ilha Formosa, arā ko motu ātaahua.

translations.source_text: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
translations.pred_target_text: I te tau 1624, ka whakatuu te Kamupene Dutch East India he turanga ki te tonga-ma-tonga o Taiwan, ka timata i te whakarereketanga o nga tikanga whakangao witi taketake me te whakamahi i nga kaimahi Hainamana ki te mahi i ana maara raihi me te huka.
translations.true_target_text: I te tau 1624,i te whakatū te Dutch East India Company i tētahi wāhi kāinga ki Taiwana ki te tonga mā uru, nā reira i tīmata ai tētahi hurihanga ki ngā tikanga whakaputa tōpata a ngā iwi taketake me te utu i ngā kaimahi Hainamana ki te mahi ki āna tupuranga raihi me te huka.

translations.source_text: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
translations.pred_target_text: I te tau 1683, ka mau nga ope a Qing (1644-1912) ki nga rohe takutai hauauru me te raki o Taiwan, ka kii ko Taiwan hei kawanatanga o te Emepaea o Qing i te tau 1885.
translations.true_target_text: I te 1638 ka whakahaerengia e ngā tauā a te whakareanga Qing te mana o Taiwan ki te uru me ngā wāhi takutai o te raki, ā, ka whakatauria ko Taiwan hei wāhanga o te Emapara Qing i te 1885.

translations.source_text: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
translations.pred_target_text: I te tau 1895, i muri i te hinganga i te Pakanga Tuatahi o Haina-Hapanihi (1894-1895), ka hainatia e te kawanatanga o Qing te Tiriti o Shimonoseki, na reira ka tukuna e ia te tino rangatiratanga o Taiwan ki a Hapani, e whakahaere ana i te motu tae noa ki te tau 1945.
translations.true_target_text: I te tau 1895, i muri i te hinga ki te Pakanga Sino-Japanese Tuatahi (1894-1895), ka hainatia e te kāwanatanga Qing te Tiriti o Shimonoseki, nā korā ia i tuku i te tino rangatiratanga o Taiwana ki Hapani, ka noho rātou hei mana whakahaere i te motu tae atu ki 1945.

translations.source_text: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
translations.pred_target_text: E toru nga hanganga matua o Machu Picchu, ko Intihuatana, ko te Whare Tapu o te Ra, me te Rua o nga Matapihi E toru.
translations.true_target_text: Ko Machu Picchu ngā hanganga matua e toru, arā ko Intihuatana, ko te Temple of the Sun, ko te Room of the Three Windows.

translations.source_text: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te nuinga o nga whare kei nga taha o te whaanui kua oti te hanga kia pai ake ai te whakaaro o nga turuhi ki te ahua o te timatanga.
