translations.source_text: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
translations.pred_target_text: Kia tae ki te tau 1976, e toru tekau paiheneti o Machu Picchu kua oti te whakaora, a kei te haere tonu te whakaoranga tae noa ki tenei ra.
translations.true_target_text: Tae atu ki te tau 1976, kua whakahaumanutia te toru tekau ōrau o Machu Picchu, ā, kei te haere tonu aua mahi whakahaumanu tae noa mai ki tēnei wā.

translations.source_text: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
translations.pred_target_text: Hei tauira, ko te 35mm te whakatakotoranga whakaahua ahua tonu i te ao, koinei te rahi o te kiriata i te mutunga o te waa kiriata tairitenga.
translations.true_target_text: Hei tauira, ko te whakatakotoranga whakaahua ū noa rawa ki te ao ko te 35mm, koirā te rahi kiriata matua i te mutunga o te wā o te kiriata ā-kiko.

translations.source_text: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
translations.pred_target_text: Kei te mahia tonutia i tenei ra, engari ko te mea nui kua riro mai i a ia nga ahuatanga o te ahua o te ahua o te ahua o te ahua o te kamera mamati.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te whakaputaina tonutia i tēnei wā, heoi anō ko te mea nui ko tōna ōwehenga aronga kua waahanga riro mai i ngā whakatakotoranga rongo whakaahua kāmera mamati

translations.source_text: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te whakatakotoranga 35mm, he ahua rangirua, 36mm te whanui me te 24mm te teitei.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te takotoranga 35mm, e rangirua ana i te mea he 36mm te whānui, te24mm te tāroa.

translations.source_text: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ahua ōwehenga o tenei whakatakotoranga (wehea ki te tekau ma rua kia whiwhi i te ōwehenga tau-katoa ngawari) ka kiia ko te 3:2.
translations.true_target_text: Nō reira ko te ōwehenga anga o tēnei hōputu (te whakawehe ki te tekau mā rua kia hua ai te ōwehenga tauoti māmā rawa) e kīia ana ko te 3:2.

translations.source_text: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga whakatakotoranga noa (APS whanau o nga whakatakotoranga, hei tauira) e rite ana, e tata tata ana ranei ki tenei ahuatanga ōwehenga.
translations.true_target_text: He maha ngā āhuatanga nei e rite nei e pā tata ana rānei ki tēnei karangatanga āwhata.

translations.source_text: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ture hautoru e tino tukinotia ana, e whakahiahia ana, he aratohu ngawari te hanga i te hihiko i te wa e pupuri ana i te raupapa o te ahua.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te ture o ngā hautoru e tino takahia ana, e tino taunuhia ana, ko tētahi aratohu māmā e hanga ana i te hihiri i te wā e pupuri tonu ana te āhua o te nahanaha ki tētahi whakaahua.

translations.source_text: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
translations.pred_target_text: E kii ana ko te waahi tino whai hua mo te kaupapa matua ko te waahi o nga raina e wehewehe ana i te ahua ki nga hautoru poutū me te whakapae (tirohia te tauira).
translations.true_target_text: Kei te kī ia ko te wāhi pai rawa mō te kaupapa matua kei te pūtahi o ngā rārangi e whakawehe ana i te whakaahua ki ngā hautoru ā-poutū, ā-huapae anō hoki (tirohia te tauira).

translations.source_text: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
translations.pred_target_text: I tenei wa o te hitori o te Pakeha, i tirotirohia te Hahi Katorika, kua whai taonga, kua kaha.
translations.true_target_text: I roto i tēnei wāhanga mō te hitori o Ūropi, i arohaehaetia te Hāhi Katorika i ōna mahi wahi rawa.

translations.source_text: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
translations.pred_target_text: Neke atu i te kotahi mano tau i herea e te Haahi Karaitiana nga whenua pakeha ahakoa nga rereketanga o te reo me nga tikanga. I

translations.source_text: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.

translations.true_target_text: I pā tana kaha rangiwhāwhā katoa i te katoa atu i te kīngi ki te tūtūā.

translations.source_text: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tetahi o nga tino tikanga Karaitiana ko te whai rawa ki te whakaiti i te mamae me te rawakore me nga putea moni a te whare karakia kei reira motuhake mo taua take.
translations.true_target_text: Ko tētahi o ngā whakapono matua Karaitiana kia whakamahia te whai rawa hei whakamāuru i te taumahatanga, i te pōhara, ā, kei reira ngā pūtea o te whare karakia mō tērā take.

translations.source_text: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
translations.pred_target_text: Neke atu i te kotahi mano tau te mana matua o te Hahi i Roma, a na te kaha o te mana me te moni i patai ai te tokomaha me te tutuki ranei tenei tikanga.
translations.true_target_text: Kua kitea te mana matua o te whare karakia ki Rōma mō te neke atu i te kotahi mano tau, ā, nā tēnei pīhangaiti o te mana me te pūtea i ara ake ki te ui a te tokomaha mēnā rānei kei te tūtakina tēnei whakapono.

translations.source_text: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
translations.pred_target_text: I muri tata mai i te pakarutanga o nga riri, ka timata a Peretana ki te aukati i nga kaipuke a Tiamana.

translations.source_text: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
translations.pred_target_text: I tino whai hua te rautaki, ka tapahia nga taonga hoia me nga taonga a-iwi, ahakoa i takahia e tenei aukati nga ture o te ao kua whakaritea e etahi whakaaetanga o te ao o nga rautau e rua kua hipa.
translations.true_target_text: I kitea te pai o te rautaki, i aukatia ngā rawa waiwai mā te tauā, mā te iwi whānui, ahakoa i takahi tēnei aukati i te ture ā-ao e whakaaetia whānuitia ana kua nahanahatia e ētahi whakaaetanga ā-ao o ngā rautau e rua kua pahure ake.

translations.source_text: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
translations.pred_target_text: I kerihia e Peretana nga wai o te ao kia kore ai nga kaipuke e kuhu ki roto i nga wahanga katoa o te moana, ka raru nga kaipuke kore.
translations.true_target_text: I maina a Peretānia i ngā wai ā-ao hei aukati i te urunga atu o ngā waipuke ki ngā wāhanga nui o te moana, nā tērā i mōrearea hoki ai ngā waipuke ngū.

translations.source_text: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

translations.source_text: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
translations.pred_target_text: I nga tau 1920, ko nga waiaro o te nuinga o nga tangata whenua me nga iwi ko te pacifism me te noho mokemoke.

translations.source_text: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.

translations.true_target_text: Nō te kitenga atu i ngā mahi whakamataku o te Pakanga Tuatahi o te Ao, i ngana katoa ngā iwi ki te ārai atu i tērā momo āhuatanga.

translations.source_text: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
translations.pred_target_text: I te tau 1884, ka neke a Tesla ki te United States of America ki te whakaae ki tetahi mahi me te Kamupene Edison i New York City.

translations.source_text: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
translations.pred_target_text: I tae mai ia ki te US me te 4 cents ki tona ingoa, he pukapuka rotarota, me tetahi reta tohutohu a Charles Batchelor (ko tana kaiwhakahaere i tana mahi o mua) ki a Thomas Edison.
translations.true_target_text: I tae atu ia ki Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika me te 4 hēneti noa iho, he pukapuka rotarota, me tētahi reta taunaki mai i Charles Batchelor (tōna kaiwhakahaere ki tāna mahi o mua) ki a Thomas Edison.

translations.source_text: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
translations.pred_target_text: He huarahi ahurei to Haina tawhito ki te whakaatu i nga wa rereke; ko ia wahanga o Haina, ia hapu ranei i te mana he rangatira motuhake.
translations.true_target_text: Kei Haina Tawhito tētahi tikanga ahurei o te whaakatu i ngā tini wā rerekē; ko ia wāhanga o Haina, ko ia whānau i whai mana rānei ko tētahi kāwai motuhake.

translations.source_text: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
translations.pred_target_text: I waenganui ano hoki i ia whare rangatira he tau pahekeheke o nga kawanatanga wehewehe. Ko te mea tino rongonui o enei wa ko te toru o nga rangatiratanga e 60 tau i waenganui i te Han me te Jin Dynasty.
translations.true_target_text: Waihoki i waenganui i ia arikitanga ko tētahi wā tikoki o ngā takiwā e noho wehe ana. Ko te wā e mōhiotia whānuitia ana o ēnei wā ko te wā Three Kingdoms i tū mō te 60 tau te roa i waenganui i te Han me te Jin Dynasty.

translations.source_text: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto i enei wa ka kaha te whawhai i waenganui i nga rangatira maha e whawhai ana mo te torona.
translations.true_target_text: I ēnei wā ka tū te pakanga aungarea i waenganui i ngā tini ariki e tohe ana mō te torōna.

translations.source_text: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga rangatiratanga e toru tetahi o nga wa tino toto i roto i te hitori o Haina Tawhito he mano nga tangata i mate i te whawhai ki te noho ki te nohoanga teitei o te whare rangatira i Xi'an.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te Three Kingdoms tētahi o ngā wā tino rere te toto i te hītori o Ancient China i mate ngā tini mano tāngata e whawhai ana kia noho ki te tūru teitei rawa ki te whare kīngi whakahira ki Xi'an.

translations.source_text: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.

translations.source_text: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.

translations.source_text: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.

translations.true_target_text: Kei te mānia o Giza, "Giza Necropolis" rānei i te Valley of the Dead o Īhipa ētahi koeko (ko te koeke rahi te mea nui rawa), ētahi toma, ētahi temepara me te Sphinx hirahira.

translations.source_text: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.

translations.source_text: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.

translations.source_text: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.

translations.source_text: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.

translations.true_target_text: I te rā 6 o Ōketopa i te tau 1769 i panaia anō atu ki Parī i Versailles e tētahi māpu wāhine mākete te hunga tino mataku a King Louis XVI rātou ko Queen Marie Antoinette ko ā rāua tamariki nohinohi tokorua (a Marie Therese 11 tau te pakeke, rāua ko Louis-Charles e 4 tau te pakeke) ko te tuahine a te Kīngi a Madam Elizabeth.

translations.source_text: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.

translations.source_text: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.

translations.source_text: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

translations.source_text: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.

translations.true_target_text: I pēhia rātou kia utu tāke ki te whakahaere koroniara o Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika hei tuku pūtea hei utu i tētahi wāhanga nui o ngā utu me te itareti o ngā hononga-moni kua whakarewaina ki te ingoa o te kāwanatanga Piripīni mā ngā whare pēke o Wall Street.

translations.source_text: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

translations.source_text: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.

translations.source_text: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tau i puta ai nga kaupapa e kiia ana ko te High Middle Ages te wa o te hitori o te Pakeha i nga rautau 11, 12, me te 13 (AD 1000–1300).
translations.true_target_text: Ko te wā i tū ai ngā mahi e kīia whānuitia ana ko ngā High Midle Ages arā te wā o te hītori Ūropi i ngā rautau 11, 12 me te 13 hoki (AD 1000-1300).

translations.source_text: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te High Middle Ages i mua ko te Early Middle Ages ka whai ko te Late Middle Ages, ka mutu te huihuinga i te takiwa o te 1500.
translations.true_target_text: I mua i te High Middle Ages ko te Early Middle Ages, ā, ka whāia e te Late Middle Ages, e kīia ana i mutu tata ki te tau 1500.

translations.source_text: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tikanga hangarau he kupu e uru ana ki te whanuitanga o nga whakaaro i roto i te mahi, mai i te hangarau-pana, i te hiahia hangarau ranei ki te tino whakaaro ko te mutunga o te tangata e akihia ana e te whakaaro hohonu e pa ana ki nga ture putaiao me o raatau whakaaturanga i roto i te hangarau.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te ākinga rangahau (technological determinism) tētahi rerenga e whakahāngai ana te whānuitanga o ngā ariā e whakamahia ana, mai i te pananga-hangarau, arā ko te pūtake hāngarau ko te huarahi a te tangata kei te kōkiritia e tētahi whakaaro whakakaupapa pūtake e hāngai ana ki ngā ture pūtaiao me ā rātou putanga ki te hangarau.

translations.source_text: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te nuinga o nga whakamaoritanga o te whakatau tikanga hangarau e rua nga whakaaro whanui: ko te whanaketanga o te hangarau ake e whai ana i tetahi huarahi i tua atu i te awenga ahurea, torangapu ranei, me te mea he "paanga" te hangarau ki runga i nga hapori e mau tonu ana, kaua ki nga tikanga a-iwi.
translations.true_target_text: E rua ngā whakaaro matua kei te nuinga o ngā whakamāramatanga o te mana motuhake hangarau: kei te whai te whanaketanga o te hangarau ake i tētahi huarahi i kō atu i te ahurea, i te whakaaweawe tōrangapū rānei, ā, he "pānga" ā-roto tonu tā te hangarau ki ngā pāori, tēnā i te heipūtanga o te tikanga ā-iwi.

translations.source_text: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
translations.pred_target_text: Hei tauira, ka kii pea tetahi ko te motuka motuka te arahi ki te whanaketanga o nga rori.
translations.true_target_text: Hei tauira, ka kīia pea ka ara noa te motokā ki te whakawhanaketanga o ngā huarahi.

translations.source_text: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
translations.pred_target_text: Heoi ano, karekau he huarahi ohanga o te motu mo te iti noa o nga motuka, na reira ka hangaia nga tikanga hanga hou hei whakaiti i te utu mo te mana waka.
translations.true_target_text: Heoi, ehara te kōtuitui huarahi ā-motu i te pai ā-ohaoha mō ētahi waka ruarua noa nei, nō reira ka whakawhanaketia ētahi rautaki hou mō te whakaputa hei whakaheke i te utu mō te hoko waka.

translations.source_text: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te mana waka papatipu ka nui ake nga aitua i runga i nga rori, e arai ana ki te hanga tikanga hou mo te tiaki hauora hei whakatika i nga tinana kua pakaru.
translations.true_target_text: Mā te pupuri waka a te tokomaha e nui ake te tupono o ngā aituā ki ngā rori, mā korā te auahatanga o ngā tikanga hou ki te hauora mō te whakatika i ngā tinana kua whara.

translations.source_text: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te Romanticism tetahi waahanga nui o te tikanga tikanga, i tangohia mai i nga kaituhi penei i a Goethe, Fichte, me Schlegel.
translations.true_target_text: I kaha te āhuatanga ahurea motuhaketanga i roto i te Romanticism, i māramatia mai i ngā kaituhi pēnei i a Goethe, i a Fichte, me Schlegel hoki.

translations.source_text: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto i te horopaki o te Romanticism, na te matawhenua i hanga i nga tangata takitahi, a, i te roanga o te wa ka ara ake nga tikanga me nga tikanga e pa ana ki taua matawhenua, a ko enei, i te mea e rite ana ki te waahi o te hapori, he pai ake i nga ture tuku noa.
translations.true_target_text: Ki te horopaki o te Romanticism, nā te takotoranga papa te tangata i aweawe, ā, puta noa i te wā i hua mai ngā tikanga me te ahurea e hāngai ana ki tērā takotoranga papa, ā, e reretau ana ēnei ki te wāhi o te papori, nō reira he pai ake i ngā ture uruhi poka noa.

translations.source_text: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
translations.pred_target_text: I te ahua o Paris e mohiotia ana ko te whakapaipai ahua o te ao o naianei, i kiia ko Constantinople te whakapaipai ahua o te feudal Europe.
translations.true_target_text: Ka pērā i te āhua o te mōhiohio o Parī hei te tāone matua mō te kākahu rorotu o te ao o nāianei, i whai whakaarohia a Constantinople hei tāone matua mō te kākahu rorotu o Ūropi i neherā.

translations.source_text: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tona rongonuitanga mo te waahi o nga mea papai i timata i te takiwa o te 400 AD, a tae noa ki te tau 1100 AD.
translations.true_target_text: E mōhio whānuitia ana hei pokapū o te hāneaneatanga, ā, i tīmata tana rongonui mō tērā i te takiwā o te A.D 400, ā, i haere tonu tae noa ki te A.D 1100.

translations.source_text: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
translations.pred_target_text: I heke tona mana i te rautau tekau ma rua na te mea i hoki mai a Crusaders me te mau koha penei i nga hiraka me nga mea kakara he nui ake te utu i nga maakete o Byzantine.
translations.true_target_text: Ka heke haere tōna tūnga i te wā o te rautau tua tekau mā rua i runga i te mōhio kua hoki mai ngā Crusaders whai koha pērā i ngā hiraka, i ngā rau kikini he nui ake te uara i tā ngā mākete Byzantine.

translations.source_text: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
translations.pred_target_text: I tenei wa ko te whakawhiti i te taitara o Fashion Capital mai i Constantinople ki Paris.
translations.true_target_text: I hua mai te taone matua whakamau pueru, mai i Constantinople ki Parī.

translations.source_text: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ahua o te ahua Gothic i eke ki runga i te waa i waenga i nga rautau 10th - 11th me te rautau 14th.
translations.true_target_text: I rangatira rawa te kaupapa Gothic mai i te rautau 10 ki te rautau 11, me te rautau 14.

translations.source_text: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.

translations.true_target_text: I te timatanga i whakaawengia te hanga kākahu e te ahurea Byzantine o te rāwhiti.

translations.source_text: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.

translations.true_target_text: Heoi, i i runga i ngā hononga whakawhiti kōrero pōturi, ka tōmuri mai pea ngā taera ki te uru mā te 25 ki te 30 tau.

translations.source_text: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
translations.pred_target_text: ki te mutunga o te Waenganui ka timata te uru o Uropi ki te whakawhanake i o raatau ake ahua. Ko tetahi o nga tino whanaketanga o tera wa na nga pakanga i timata te tangata ki te whakamahi patene hei whakamau kakahu.
translations.true_target_text: tata ki te mutunga o ngā Middle Ages i tīmata a Ūropi ki te uru te whakawhanake i tā rātou ake huatau. ko tētahi o ngā whanaketanga nui rawa o te wā i hua mai i ngā ekenga ka tīmata ngā tāngata ki te whakamahi pātene hei whakamau kākahu.

translations.source_text: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ahuwhenua oranga ko te mahi ahuwhenua e mahia ana kia nui ai te kai hei whakatutuki i nga hiahia o te kaiahuwhenua me tona whanau.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te ahuwhenua mō te hapori ko te ahuwhenua e whakahaerehia ana hei whakatipu i te rawaka o te kai hei tutuki anake i ngā hiahia o te kaiahuwhenua rātou ko tōna whānau.

translations.source_text: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ahuwhenua oranga he punaha ngawari, he mea pararopi tonu, ma te whakamahi i nga kakano kua tiakina mai i te whenua o te rohe whenua me te hurihanga hua me etahi atu tikanga ngawari hei whakanui ake i nga hua.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te ahuwhenua-tiaki-ake he pūnaha māmā, i te nuinga o te wā he māori, e whakamahi ana i ngā kākano māori ki te wāhi pūnaha hauropi rā, e whakakotahitia ana ki te huringa hua, ki ētahi atu tikanga āhua māmā kia rahi ai ngā hua ka puta.

translations.source_text: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
translations.pred_target_text: I nga wa o mua ko te nuinga o nga kaiahuwhenua e mahi ana i nga mahi ahuwhenua oranga, a, kei te noho tonu tenei i roto i te maha o nga whenua whakawhanake.
translations.true_target_text: I mua i te whai wāhi te nuinga o ngā kaipāmu ki te ahuwhenua whāngai i a rātou anō, ā, e pēnei tonu ana ki ngā tini whenua e whanake ana.

translations.source_text: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakahiatohia e nga ahurea-iti nga tangata rite tonu te whakaaro kua warewarehia e nga paerewa hapori me te tuku i a raatau ki te whakawhanake i te tuakiri.
translations.true_target_text: Ka whakaemi ngā ahurea āpiti i ngā hunga e rite nei ngā whakaaro, te hunga kua peia atu e te pāpori, nā taea e rātou te whakawhanake i tō rātou ake āhua tuakiri.

translations.source_text: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga ahurea iti ka rereke na te pakeke, te matawaka, te karaehe, te waahi, me te ira tangata o nga mema.
translations.true_target_text: Ka motuhake pea te ahurea-ā-hapū i te mea o te pakeketanga, o te iwi, o te akomanga, o te wāhi me te ira tangata o te mema hoki rānei.

translations.source_text: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga ahuatanga e whakatau ana i tetahi ahurea iti he rereke pea ko te reo, te rerehua, te whakapono, te torangapu, te ira tangata, te matawhenua, me te huinga o nga mea.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā āhuatanga ka whakatau he rerekē te ahurea ā-hapū ko te reo, ko te āhuatanga, te hāhi, te tōrangapū, te aitanga, te takoto whenua, te kōnanunanutanga rānei o ētahi mea.

translations.source_text: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga wa e tohu ana nga mema o te ahurea iti i to raatau mema ma te whakamahi i te ahua motuhake me te tohu tohu, tae atu ki nga ahua, nga tikanga, me te aro.
translations.true_target_text: He auau te tohu a ngā mema o tētahi ahurea āpiti i tā rātou whai wāhitanga mā tētahi whakamahinga āhua he rerekē, he tohu, kei roto ko ngā āhua, ngā tū, ko ngā huinga kupu.

translations.source_text: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tetahi o nga tikanga e whakamahia ana hei whakaatu i te hiranga o te whakahoahoa ko te tango i nga keehi iti o nga tamariki na te warewaretanga, na te aitua, na te mahi tukino ranei, kare i whakahoahia e nga pakeke i a ratou e tipu ana.
translations.true_target_text: Ko tētahi o ngā tīno rautaki e whakamahia ai hei whakatauira i te hirahiratanga o te whakahoahoa he kōrero mō ngā āhuatanga pōuri o ngā tamariki i waiho kaungia, i harangia, i patungia rānei, i kore rānei i tīakina e ngā mātua i tō rātou ohinga ake.

translations.source_text: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko enei tamariki ka kiia he "feral" he mohoao ranei. Ko etahi o nga tamariki mohoao kua herea e te tangata (te nuinga o o ratau ake matua); i etahi wa na te korenga o nga matua i te mate hinengaro, tinana ranei o te tamaiti.
translations.true_target_text: Kua kīia ngā tamariki pēnei he "kūao" he mohoao rānei. Ko ētahi tamariki kūao kua herea e te tangata (i te nuinga o te wā ko ō rātou ake mātua); i ētahi wā i ahu mai tēnei whakarerenga tamaiti i te pana a ngā mātua i te tino hauātanga ā-hinengaro, ā-tinana rānei a te tamaiti.

translations.source_text: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga tamariki mohoao kua pa ki te tukino tamariki, ki te mamae ranei i mua i te whakarerea, i te oma ranei.
translations.true_target_text: Akuanei pea i pāngia ngā tamariki mohowao e te whakamanioro, e te kino i mua i te waiho kau, i te omanga atu rānei.

translations.source_text: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko etahi e kiia ana na nga kararehe i whakatupuria; e ai ki etahi i noho ki te mohoao ko ratou anake.
translations.true_target_text: Kua whakapaetia ētahi atu kua whakatipuria e te kararehe; e kīia ana kua noho mohoao ētahi ki tōna kotahi.

translations.source_text: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
translations.pred_target_text: Ina whakatipuria katoatia e nga kararehe ehara i te tangata, ka whakaatu te tamaiti mohoao i nga whanonga (i roto i nga rohe o te tinana) tata katoa ki te ahua o te kararehe tiaki, penei i tana wehi ki te tangata.
translations.true_target_text: Ina whakatipuria katoatia e te kararehe ehara i te tangata, ka whakaatu te tamaiti mohoao i ngā whanonga (i roto tonu i ngā here ā-kiko) kei te pērā katoa i ērā o te kararehe-tiaki ake, pērā i tana mataku, tana kore aro rānei ki te tangata.

translations.source_text: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa ko te ako i runga i te kaupapa kia ngawari ake te ako me te whakahihiri ake, ka neke atu te scaffolding.
translations.true_target_text: Ahakoa me māmā ake, me manawa reka ake hoki te ako mā te ako pūtake kaupapa, ka neke atu te whakatīrewa i tērā.

translations.source_text: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
translations.pred_target_text: Ehara te scaffolding i te tikanga ako engari he awhina e tautoko ana i nga tangata kei te whai wheako ako hou penei i te whakamahi i te kaupapa rorohiko hou, i te timata kaupapa hou ranei.
translations.true_target_text: Ehara te tīrewa i tētahi tikanga hou o te ako, engari kē ia he mea tautoko e tuku ana i te tautoko ki ngā takitahi e whai ana i tētahi wheako ako hou, pērā i te whakamahi i tētahi pūmanawa rorohiko hou, te tīmata rānei i tētahi kaupapa hou.

translations.source_text: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea te mariko me te mooni te Scaffolds, ara, he kaiako te ahua o te scaffold engari he pera ano te tangata iti i roto i te Microsoft Office.
translations.true_target_text: Ka taea ngā tīrewa ā-mariko, ā-kiko hoki, arā, he momo tīrewa te kaiako engari ka pērā hoki te tangata pine pepa paku ki Microsoft Office.

translations.source_text: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga Scaffolds Mariko kua whakauruhia ki roto i te rorohiko me te tikanga ki te patapatai, ki te akiaki, ki te whakamarama hoki i nga tikanga ka raru pea ma te akonga anake e whakahaere.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te hangaia ki roto i te pūmanawa ngā Tīrewa Mariko (Virtual Scaffolds), ā, ko tā rātou mahi he ui, he whāngai kupu, he whakamārama hoki i ngā hātepe kua uaua rawa mā te ākonga te whakahaere i tōna kotahi.

translations.source_text: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakanohoia nga tamariki ki roto i te Foster Care mo te maha o nga take mai i te warewaretanga, ki te tukino, tae noa ki te muru.
translations.true_target_text: He nui ngā āhuatanga e whāngaihia ai te tamaiti, mai i te korenga o ōna mātua e manaaki i a ia ki ngā mahi tūkino tamariki, tae atu ki ngā mahi nanakia hoki.

translations.source_text: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
translations.pred_target_text: Kaua rawa he tamaiti kia tipu ake i roto i te taiao kaore i te poipoi, i te manaaki, i te ako, engari ka tupu.
translations.true_target_text: Me kaua rawa tētahi tamaiti e tipu ake ki te taiao kāore i te noho taurima, āroharoha, whakaako hoki, engari anō ka pērā.

translations.source_text: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
translations.pred_target_text: Ki ta matou whakaaro he waahi haumaru te Pūnaha Tiaki Poutama mo enei tamariki.
translations.true_target_text: E whakaaro ana mātou he wāhi haumaru te Foster Care System mā ēnei tamariki.

translations.source_text: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tikanga ko ta maatau punaha atawhai ka whakarato i nga kaainga haumaru, i nga kaitiaki aroha, i te maatauranga pumau, me te tiaki hauora pono.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te tikanga he kāinga haumaru ngā kainga tiaki whāngai, he mātua āroha hoki, he whai mātauranga pai, he pai hoki te taha hauora.

translations.source_text: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tikanga ko te tiaki i te whare whangai nga mea e matea ana i te kainga i tangohia mai i mua.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te tikanga , ka pai ake te noho a te whāngai ki ēnei kāinga i ngā kainga i noho ai rātou.

translations.source_text: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakakotahi te Ipurangi i nga huānga o te whakawhitiwhitinga papatipu me te tangata.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te whakakotahi te Ipurangi i ngā pūmotu o te papatipu me te whakawhitinga whaiaro anō hoki.

translations.source_text: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga ahuatanga motuhake o te Ipurangi e arahi ana ki etahi atu waahanga mo te whakamahi me te huarahi pai.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā āhuahanga rerekē o te Ipurangi ka ar atu ki ngā āhuatanga tāpiri e pā an ki te aronga whakamahi me te ngata.

translations.source_text: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
translations.pred_target_text: Hei tauira, ko te "ako" me te "whakawhanaungatanga" e whakaarohia ana hei kaupapa whakahirahira mo te whakamahi Ipurangi (James et al., 1995).
translations.true_target_text: Hei tauira, e marohitia ana te "ako" me te "pāhekoheko" hei whakahihikotanga hira mō te whakamahinga Ipurangi (James et al., 1995).

translations.source_text: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te "whakawhanaungatanga whaiaro" me te "whakawhanaungatanga tonu" i kitea ano he ahuatanga whakahihiko hou na Eighmey me McCord (1998) i te wa i tirotirohia e ratou nga urupare a te hunga whakarongo ki nga paetukutuku.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te "whakauru takitahi" me te "tōai whanaungatanga" i tautohua hei mea whakaaweawe hou mai i a Eighmey me McCord (1998) i te wā rātou i whakawā i ngā putanga o ngā minenga i te ipurangi.

translations.source_text: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te whakamahinga o te rekoata riipene whakaata kua puta mai nga kitenga nui i roto i te whakamaoritanga o nga whakaaturanga moroiti, nga nekehanga kanohi e mau ana mo etahi manomano.
translations.true_target_text: Kua ahu mai i te whakamahinga o te mau ataata ki ngā kitenga whakahirahira ki te whakamāramatanga o ngā ihiihi-paku, arā ko ngā nekehanga kanohi he mirihēkona ruarua noa te roa.

translations.source_text: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
translations.pred_target_text: Ina koa, e kii ana ka taea e te tangata te kite mena kei te korero teka te tangata ma te whakamaori tika i nga korero moroiti.
translations.true_target_text: Inarā, e kīia ana ka taea te kite mēnā kei te rūkahu tētahi tangata mā te whakamārama tika i ngā ihiihi paku rawa.

translations.source_text: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko Oliver Sacks, i roto i tana pepa Ko te Korero a te Perehitini, i tohu me pehea te hunga kaore e mohio ki te korero na te kino o te roro ka taea te aromatawai tika i te pono.
translations.true_target_text: I roto i tā Oliver Sacks pepa The President's Speech, e kōrero ana mō te nui o ngā tāngata kāore e mārama ki te kōrero ko te mate roro te take ka taea tonu e rātou te mārama tika ki ngā kare-ā-roto.

translations.source_text: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tana whakaaro ko enei kaha ki te whakamaori i nga whanonga tangata ka taea e nga kararehe penei i nga kuri o te kainga.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te marohi tonu ia ko ngā āheinga pērā mō te whakamārama i ngā whanonga ā-tāngata ka noho tahi hoki ki ngā kararehe pērā i ngā kurī whakarata.

translations.source_text: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga rangahau o te rautau rua tekau e whakaatu ana e rua nga puna o te rereketanga o te ira: huna me te whakaatu.
translations.true_target_text: Kua whakaaturia e te rangahau o te rautau rua tekau e rua ngā rōpū o te rerenga ira tangata: ko te mea huna, ko te mea puaki.

translations.source_text: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taapirihia e te ira he rerekeetanga ira hou, ka tangohia mai e te kowhiringa mai i te puna o nga rereketanga kua whakaatuhia.
translations.true_target_text: Mā te irakē e tāpiri te rerenga ira hou, ā, mā te kōwhiringa e wewete mai i te puna o te rerenga e putaputa ana.

translations.source_text: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te wehewehe me te whakakotahitanga ka riwhi i te rereketanga ki waenga i nga puna e rua me ia reanga.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te whakatāuki me te whakakotahi anō ka tuku atu, ka tuku mai i te rerenga i waenganui i ngā rōpū e rua ki ia reanga.

translations.source_text: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
translations.pred_target_text: I runga i te savanna, he uaua mo te primate he punaha nanatu penei i te tangata ki te whakatutuki i ana hiahia waikawa amino mai i nga rawa tipu e waatea ana.
translations.true_target_text: I roto i te Savanna, he uaua mō te whāngote waewae-rua he pūnaha nakunaku kai tōnā pēnei i te tangata kia pai ai tana kapo i ngā waikawa amino mai i ngā hua o te tipu.

translations.source_text: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
translations.pred_target_text: Hau atu â, te oreraa e na reira, e mau faahopearaa ino roa ïa: te hepohepo o te tupuraa, te maa ore, e te pohe.
translations.true_target_text: Waihoki, ki te kore pērā ka taumaha ngā hua: ka pēhia te tipunga, ka ngoikore te taikaha, ā, nā wai rā ka hemo.

translations.source_text: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga rauemi tipu tino ngawari ki te toro atu ko nga pūmua kei roto i nga rau me nga remu, engari he uaua enei ma nga primata penei me tatou ki te keri mena ka maoa.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te hua o te rākau e tino wātea ana ko ngā pūmua kei roto i ngā rau me ngā rākau pī, heoi he uaua mō ngā whāngote waewae-rua pēnei i a tātou te nakunaku i ēnei kai ki te kore e tunua.

translations.source_text: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
translations.pred_target_text: He rereke, ko nga kai kararehe (popokopoko, anawae, huaki) ehara i te mea ngawari noa te kemu, engari ka whakarato i nga pūmua nui kei roto nga waikawa amino tino nui.
translations.true_target_text: Hei whakatairitenga, ehara i te mea he māmā anake ki te nakunaku i te kai kararehe (pōpokorua, ngārara, hēkī) engari he nui hoki te pūmua o roto me ngā waikawa amino waiwai katoa.

translations.source_text: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakaarohia nga mea katoa, kaua tatou e miharo mena ka whakatauhia e o tatou tupuna a raatau "raruraru pūmua" he rite tonu ki nga mahi a te chimps i runga i te savanna i enei ra.
translations.true_target_text: I te mutunga iho, me kaua tātou e ohorere mēnā i whakaea ō tātou ake tūpuna i tā rātou "raru pūmua" āhua pērā i tā ngā makimaki mōhio ki te whenua hawana (savanna) i tēnei wā.

translations.source_text: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te haukoti mo te moe ko te tikanga o te oho i te wa e moe ana koe me te moe mo te wa poto i muri mai (10-60 meneti).
translations.true_target_text: Ko te kokoti moe ko te hātepe o te āta whakaoho i te wā noa o tō moe, me te hoki ki te moe tētahi wā poto whai muri ake (10-60 ngā meneti).

translations.source_text: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea te mahi ma te whakamahi i te karaka whakaoho kia ata noho koe me te kore e oho.
translations.true_target_text: Ka māmā te mahi pēnei mā te whakamahi i tētahi matawā whakaara āhua ngū kia tō mai koe ki te ao mārama karekau te oho katoa.

translations.source_text: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
translations.pred_target_text: Mena ka kite koe kei te tautuhi ano koe i te karaka i roto i to moe, ka taea te whakanoho ki tera taha o te ruma, ka akiaki koe kia puta mai i te moenga ki te whakaweto.
translations.true_target_text: Ki te kite koe i tō whakarite anō i te karaka i te wā e moe ana koe, ka taea te whakatakoto ki tērā atu taha o te rūma, hei reira koe me peke atu i te moenga hei weto.

translations.source_text: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko etahi atu whiringa e pa ana ki te koiora ko te inu nui o te wai (ina koa te wai, te tii ranei, he rongoa rongoa) i mua i te moe, ka akiaki i te tangata kia ara ki te mimi.
translations.true_target_text: Ētahi kē atu kōwhiringa o te mahi i runga i te rere o te rā ko te inu i te nui o ngā wē (inarā te wai, te tī rānei, pai mō te whakaputa mimi) i mua i te moe, nō reira me maranga te tangata ki te mimi.

translations.source_text: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te nui o te rangimarie o roto kei te tangata e pa ana ki te taumahatanga o te tinana me te wairua.
translations.true_target_text: E hāngai tauaro ana te rahi o te rongo ā-roto o te tangata ki te rahi o te tanuku ki te tinana, te manawa pā ki te wairua hoki.

translations.source_text: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te iti ake o te taumahatanga, ka pai ake te kaha o te oranga. Kei ia tangata te kaha ki te kite i te tino rangimarie me te makona.
translations.true_target_text: Nā te iti ake o te mauri ka nui ake ai te mauri pai o koneki. Kei ia tangata te pito mata kia rapu i te rangimarie me te māuruuru roa.

translations.source_text: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea e nga tangata katoa te whakatutuki i te maaramatanga. Ko te mea anake e tu ana i te huarahi o tenei whainga ko to tatou ake raruraru me te kino.
translations.true_target_text: Ka taea e te katoa te tae atu ki te māramatanga. Ko te ārai anake e tū ana ki te ara o tēnei whāinga ko tō tātou ake manawa pā, whakakāhoretanga hoki.

translations.source_text: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te Tibetan Buddhism i ahu mai i nga whakaakoranga a Buddha, engari na te ara mahayana o te aroha me te maha o nga tikanga mai i te Yoga Inia.
translations.true_target_text: E hāngai ana te Tibetan Buddhism ki ā Buddha whakaakoranga, engari i whakawhānuingia e te ara aroha o mahayana me ngā tini āhua ā-mahi o te ioka nō Īnia.

translations.source_text: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tikanga he tino ngawari te Buddhist Tibet. Kei roto ko Kundalini Yoga, te whakaaroaro me te huarahi o te aroha awhi katoa.
translations.true_target_text: E mārama ana te Tibetan Buddhism. Ko te Kundalini Yoga, ko te whakamanatu me te huarahi mātua ki te aroha mutunga-kore.

translations.source_text: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
translations.pred_target_text: Ma te Kundalini Yoga ka oho te kaha Kundalini (te kaha o te whakamarama) na roto i nga tuuranga yoga, nga mahi manawa, nga mantra me nga tirohanga.
translations.true_target_text: Ki te Kundalini Yoga ka whakaohotia te ngao Kundalini (te ngao māramatanga) mā ngā tūnga ioka, ngā mahi hā, ngā kīanga whakatau, me te aronga ki ngā wawata.

translations.source_text: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te pokapū o te whakaaroaro Tibet ko te Yoga Yoga. Ma te whakakitenga o nga momo atua ka horoia nga awa hiko, ka whakahohehia nga chakras ka hangaia te maaramatanga.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te pokapū o te whakatau whakaaro Tipete ko te Deity Yoga. Mā te whakaaro ā-ataata ki ngā tini atua ka whakawāteatia ngā ia ngoi, ka kāngia ngā hakara (chakra), ā, ka hangaia te māramatanga.

translations.source_text: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
translations.pred_target_text: He hoariri noa a Tiamana i te Pakanga Tuarua o te Ao, na te mahi tahi i waenga i te USSR me USA. I te mutunga o te pakanga na nga tukinga o te punaha, te tikanga me te tikanga ka hinga nga whenua.
translations.true_target_text: He hoariri whānui a Tiamani i te Pakanga Tuarua o te Ao, i runga i tērā ka mahi tahi a USSR me Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika. I te mutunga o te pakanga ka pukuriri ēnei whenua ki a rāua anō i te mea o te tūtukitanga o te pūnaha, o te hātepe me te ahurea i pēnei ai.

translations.source_text: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
translations.pred_target_text: I te rua o nga tau o te mutunga o te pakanga, he hoa riri nga hoa o mua, ka timata te Pakanga Matao.
translations.true_target_text: I te rua tau o te mutunga o te pakanga, he hoariri ngā hoa o mua ināianei, ā, i tīmata te Cold War.

translations.source_text: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka mau tonu mo nga tau 40 e whai ake nei, ka whawhai tonu, ma nga ope takawaenga, i nga papa pakanga mai i Awherika ki Ahia, i Afghanistan, Cuba me etahi atu waahi.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tū mō te 40 tau i te whai ake nei, ā, ka tūturu te whawhai, e ngā ope tauā whakakapi, ki ngā papariri atu i Āwherika ki Āhia, ki Afghanistan, ki Kīupa, ki ngā tini whenua anō.

translations.source_text: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
translations.pred_target_text: I te 17 no Setepa 1939, ua parari a‘ena te parururaa no Polonia, e te tiaturiraa hoê roa o te ho‘iraa ïa e te faanaho-faahou-raa na nia i te e‘a piriti no Romania.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tae ki te 17 o Hepetema, ka pakaru kē atu te pae ārai Polish, ko te tūmanako nui kia hoki anō, ka whakatika ake anō ki ngā whakawhitinga o Rōmania.

translations.source_text: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
translations.pred_target_text: Heoi, kua ngaro enei mahere tata mo te po, i te wa neke atu i te 800,000 nga hoia mai i te Soviet's Union Red Army i uru mai ki te hanga i nga rohe o Belarusian me Iukereiniana i muri i te whakaekenga i nga rohe ki te rawhiti o Poland i te takahi i te Riga Peace Treaty, te Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression. Pact, me etahi atu tiriti o te ao, rua taha me te taha maha.
translations.true_target_text: Heoi anō, i noho korehāhā ēnei mahere i te tata ki te kotahi pō, i te kuhu atu me te hanga a te neke atu i te 800,000 hoia i te Red Army a te Soviet Union i ngā pae Belarussian me te Ukranian i muri i te eke ki ngā rohe rāwhiti o Pōrana me te takahi i te Riga Peace Treaty, te Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, me ētahi atu tiriti ā-ao, i waenganui i ngā whenua e rua, whenua takitini rānei.

translations.source_text: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te whakamahi kaipuke ki te kawe taonga te huarahi tino pai ki te neke i te tini o nga tangata me nga taonga ki nga moana.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te whakamahinga o te kaipuke te rautaki pai rawa kia kawe i ngā tini tāngata me ngā rawa i te moana.

translations.source_text: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te mahi a nga manuao i mua ko te whakapumau i te kaha o to whenua ki te neke i to iwi me nga taonga, i te wa ano, ka pokanoa i te kaha o to hoariri ki te neke i tana iwi me ana taonga.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te mahi a te ope tauā moana he whakarite kia āhei ai tō whenua te āheinga kia neke i ō tāngata me ngā rawa, ā, i te wā orite e whakararu ana i ā te hoariri āheinga ki te neke i āna tāngata me āna rawa.

translations.source_text: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko tetahi o nga tauira tino rongonui o tenei wa ko te pakanga ki te Raki o Atlantic o te Pakanga Tuarua. Kei te ngana nga Ameliká ki te neke i nga tangata me nga taonga ki te taha o te Moana-a-Kiwa ki te awhina i a Peretana.
translations.true_target_text: Ko tētahi o ngā tauira whakamiramira nō nākuanei o tēnei ko te kauhanga riri North Atlantic o Te Pakanga Tuarua o te Ao. I ngana ngā Amerikana ki te whakaneke i ngā tāne, i ngā rawa whakawhiti atu i te Atlantic Ocean hei āwhina i a Peretānia.

translations.source_text: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
translations.pred_target_text: I taua wa ano, kei te ngana te navy Tiamana, te nuinga o nga waka U, ki te aukati i tenei waka.
translations.true_target_text: I taua wā tonu, i te ngana te tauā-moana o Tiamani te whakatū i te hohoko mā te whakamahi i ngā poti-U.

translations.source_text: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
translations.pred_target_text: Mehemea i hinga nga Hoia, kua kaha pea a Tiamana ki te wikitoria i a Peretana pera i era atu o Uropi.
translations.true_target_text: Mena kua i hinga ngā hoawhawhai, Kua kore pea e riro i a Tiamana a Piritania pēnei i te rironga o te toinga o Europi.

translations.source_text: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te ahua kua whangaia tuatahitia nga koati tata ki te 10,000 tau ki muri i nga maunga o Zagros o Iran.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te āhua nei i whakararatatia ngā nanekoti tata ki te 10,000 tau ki muri ki ngā Zagros Mountains ki Irāna.

translations.source_text: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
translations.pred_target_text: I timata nga ahurea me nga iwi o mua ki te pupuri i aua mea kia ngawari te uru ki te miraka, te makawe, te kiko me te hiako.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tīmata ngā ahurea me ngā iwi tawhito te pupuri i ērā kia māmā ai te āheinga atu ki te miraka, te huruhuru, te kiko, me ngā kirimoko.

translations.source_text: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
translations.pred_target_text: I te nuinga o te wa ka mau nga koati i roto i nga kahui e kopikopiko ana i runga i nga puke, i etahi atu wahi kai, he maha nga wa e whangaia ana e nga hepara koati he tamariki, he taiohi ranei, he rite ki te hepara e mohiotia ana. Kei te whakamahia tonu enei tikanga whangai i enei ra.
translations.true_target_text: I rāhuitia ngā koti ki tētahi kāhui karore haere i ngā maunga me ngā pātiki, i manaakitia ai e te hunga tamariki, tōna rite ki te hēpara. E whakamahia tonutia ana ēnei tikanga ārahi kararehe i ēnei rā.

translations.source_text: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
translations.pred_target_text: I hangaia nga huarahi waka ki Ingarangi i te timatanga o te 16th Century.
translations.true_target_text: I hangaia ngā kāta ki Ingaringi i te tīmatanga o te rautau 16.

translations.source_text: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
translations.pred_target_text: Ahakoa he papa rakau whakarara noa nga ara o nga kaata, ka taea e nga hoiho te toia kia tere ake te tere me te toia i nga uta nui atu i nga huarahi taratara ake o te ra.
translations.true_target_text: Akakoa ko ngā ara wākena ko ngā papa rākau whakarara noa iho, i whakahei rātou i ngā hoiho e tō ana i a rātou te eke ki ngā tere nui ake me te tō i ngā wahanga nui ake i tērā ki ngā huarahi tuaranga o te wā.

translations.source_text: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakaurua mai nga Crossties moata tonu hei pupuri i nga ara. Heoi, i te ata haere, ka mohiohia ka pai ake nga ara ki te mea he toka rino kei runga.
translations.true_target_text: I whakatō āhua moata ngā Crossties kia mau pū i ngā ara ki tana wāhi. Nāwai rā, heoi anō, i āta kitea i te painga kē atu o ngā ara mēnā i he wāhanga mētara iti ki runga.

translations.source_text: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
translations.pred_target_text: Ua riro te reira ei peu matauhia, tera râ, na te auri i faaino roa i te mau huira raau o te mau pereoo.
translations.true_target_text: I tū tēnei hei tikanga noa, engari nā te rino i kaha ake te taiākotikoti ki ngā wīra wāpu o ngā wēkana.

translations.source_text: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
translations.pred_target_text: I te mutunga, ka whakakapihia nga wira rakau ki nga wira rino. I te tau 1767, i whakauruhia nga reera rino tuatahi.
translations.true_target_text: Tāria te wā, i whakakapia ngā wīra rākau ki ngā wīra rino. I te tau 1767, i kitea tuatahitia ngā ara tereina tuatahi he rino-katoa.

translations.source_text: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te waka tuatahi i mohiotia ko te hikoi, ka timata te tangata ki te hikoi tika i te rua miriona tau ki muri i te putanga mai o Homo Erectus (te tikanga he tangata tika).
translations.true_target_text: Ko te hīkoi te ikiiki tuatahi i mōhiotia, i tīmata tā te tangata hīkoi matika e rua miriona tau ki muri, i te aranga mai o te Homo Erectus (e kī ana te tangata matika).

translations.source_text: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko o ratou mua, ko te Australopithecus kaore i tika te hikoi pera i nga tikanga.
translations.true_target_text: Ō rātou whakamuanga, ngā Australopithecus, kāore i pēnā rawa te hīkoi whakarunga i ngā wā katoa.

translations.source_text: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka kitea nga tohungatanga bipedal i roto i nga parapara o Australopithecus mai i te 4.2-3.9 miriona tau ki muri, ahakoa i hikoi a Sahelanthropus i runga i nga waewae e rua mai i te whitu miriona tau ki muri.
translations.true_target_text: E kitea ana ngā āhuatanga rua-waewae i roto i ngā mātātoka Australopithecus mai i ngā tau 4.2-3.9 miriona ki muri, he ahakoa i hīkoi pea te Sahelanthropus ki ngā waewae e rua e whitu miriona tau ki muri.

translations.source_text: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea e tatou te timata ki te noho pai ki te taiao, ka uru tatou ki te kaupapa taiao, ka taea ano hoki te mahi hei kaiwhakatairanga hei whakaiti i nga mamae a meake nei.
translations.true_target_text: Ka taea e tātou te tīmata ki te noho pai ake me te taiao, ka taea e tātou te tūhono ki te kotahitanga mō te taiao, ka taea hoki e tātou te tū hei kaiwhakatūtū kia āhua whakahiki i te pākatokato hei te wā e heke mai ana.

translations.source_text: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
translations.pred_target_text: He rite tonu tenei ki te maimoatanga tohu i te maha o nga keehi. Heoi, ki te kore tatou e pirangi ki tetahi otinga rangitahi, me rapu tatou i te putake o nga raruraru, me whakawetohia e tatou.
translations.true_target_text: E ōrite ana tēnei ki te whakamaimoatanga o ngā tohumate i ētahi wā. Heoi anō, ki te kore tātou e hiahia ki te rongoā taupua noa iho, me rapu tātou i te aka o ngā raru, ā, me whakakore e tātou.

translations.source_text: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
translations.pred_target_text: E mea papu maitai e ua taui roa te ao nei na roto i te mau haereraa i mua i te pae aivanaa e te mau ravea aravihi o te taata, e ua rahi roa te mau fifi no te rahi o te huiraatira e te huru oraraa rahi o te taata.
translations.true_target_text: E mārama ana kua huri nei ao i ngā mahi a te ira tangata ā-pūtaiao nei, ā-hangarau nei hoki, ā, kua nui kē atu ngā raruraru kua pā mai i te kōpā rawa o te noho a ngā iwi i te ātaahuatanga a te noho a tatou te tangata.

translations.source_text: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
translations.pred_target_text: Whai muri i tana whakatamarikitanga e te Runanga i te 4 o Hurae, i hainatia e te Perehitini o te Runanga a John Hancock me te Hekeretari a Charles Thomson tetahi tauira i hainatia e te Perehitini o te Runanga a Charles Thomson i etahi poraka ki te toa ta o John Dunlap.
translations.true_target_text: Whai muri i tana whakaaetanga e te Congress i te rā 4 o Hūrae, ka tukuna tētahi tuhinga hukihuki kua hainatia e te President of Congress a John Hancock rāua ko Secretary Charles Thompson ētahi poraka atu ki te toa tā a John Dunlap.

translations.source_text: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
translations.pred_target_text: I te po i waenganui i te 150 ki te 200 kape i mahia, e mohiotia ana inaianei ko "Dunlap broadsides".
translations.true_target_text: I roto i te pō i waenganui i te 150 me te 200 ngā kape i hangaia, e mōhiotia ana ināianei ko ngā "Dunlap broadsides".

translations.source_text: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko John Nixon te panui tuatahi o te tuhinga i te iari o te Whare o Independence Hall i te 8 o Hurae.
translations.true_target_text: Nā John Nixon te pānuitanga tūmatanui tuatahi o te puka ki te iari o te Independence Hall i te 8 o Hūrae.

translations.source_text: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
translations.pred_target_text: I tukuna tetahi ki a George Washington i te 6 o Hurae, nana i panui ki tana ope i New York i te 9 o Hurae. I tae atu tetahi kape ki London i te 10 o Akuhata.
translations.true_target_text: I tukuna tētahi ki a George Washington i te 6 o Hūrae, ka pānuitia ki ōna hōia i New york i te 9 o Hūrae. I tae he kape ki Rānana i te 10 o Akuhata.

translations.source_text: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga taha whanui 25 o Dunlap e mohiotia ana kei te noho tonu ko nga kape tawhito rawa atu o te tuhinga. Ko te kape taketake i tuhia e te ringaringa kaore ano kia ora.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā Dunlap taha-whānui (Broadsides) e 25 e mōhiotia tonutia ana ko ngā tāruatanga tawhiti rawa e toe ana o te puka. Kāore te tuhinga tūturu ā-ringa i te toe tonu.

translations.source_text: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
translations.pred_target_text: E rave rahi mau taata tuatapapa i te pae o te mau fenua i teie mahana te tiaturi nei e ua ora mai te hoê pǔpǔ dinosaures e te ora nei i teie mahana. Ka kiia e matou he manu.
translations.true_target_text: Tokomaha ngā tohunga mātātoka i tēnei wā e whakapono ana ko tētahi rōpū mokonui i mōrehurehu, ā, kei te ora tonu i tēnei wā. E kīia ana e tātou he manu.

translations.source_text: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga tangata kaore i te whakaaro he mokoweri ratou na te mea he huruhuru o ratou, ka taea te rere.
translations.true_target_text: He tini ngā tāngata kāore e whakapop ana he tainahoro ērā rā i te mea he huruhuru ōna, ā, e taea te rere.

translations.source_text: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
translations.pred_target_text: Engari he maha nga mea mo nga manu e rite tonu ana ki te mokoweri.
translations.true_target_text: He tini ngā mea o te manu e rite tonu nei ki te tainahora.

translations.source_text: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
translations.pred_target_text: He waewae me te unahi me te maikuku, ka whakatakoto hua, ka haere i runga i o raua waewae e rua o muri ano he T-Rex.
translations.true_target_text: He waewae unaunahi me te matikuku, ka whakawhānau hēki, ā, ka hīkoi i runga i ōna waewae ō muri pēnei i te T-Rex.

translations.source_text: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
translations.pred_target_text: Tata ki nga rorohiko katoa e whakamahia ana i enei ra e hangai ana i runga i te raweke o nga korero kua tohua ki te ahua o nga tau rua.
translations.true_target_text: I te nuinga o te wā ko ngā rorohiko e whakamahia nei i ēnei rā nei kua hanga anō he rāwekeweke i ngā pitopito kōrero kua hangaia i roto i ngā āhuatanga o ngā nama tāhūrua.

translations.source_text: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea e te tau-rua te whai i tetahi o nga uara e rua, ara, 0, 1 ranei, ka kiia enei tau he mati-rua - he moka ranei, hei whakamahi i nga kupu rorohiko.
translations.true_target_text: Ka taea anake e tētahi tau tāhūrua te whai i tētahi o ngā uara e rua, arā te 0, te 1 rānei, ā, e kīia ana ēnei tau hei mati tāhūrua - hei moka ranei, kia whakamahia te kupu rorohiko.

translations.source_text: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
translations.pred_target_text: Kare pea te paihana o roto e kitea tonutia. Ko nga tohu, penei i te ruaki he tino whanui e kore e taea te whakatau tata.
translations.true_target_text: Kāore pea te paihana ō roto e kitea inamatangia. Ko ngā tohu mate, pēnei i te ruaki he noa te āhua kia kore e taea te whakatau māuiui i taua wā tonu.

translations.source_text: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tohu pai mo te paihana o roto ko te noho o tetahi ipu rongoa rongoa me nga matū paitini o te whare.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te tohu pai rawa o te paihana ā-roto ko te noho ki reira a tētahi ipu tuwhera o te rongoā, o ngā matū ā-whare tāoke rānei.

translations.source_text: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
translations.pred_target_text: Tirohia te tapanga mo nga tohutohu awhina tuatahi mo taua paihana.
translations.true_target_text: Tirohia te tapanga mō ngā tohutohu āwhina tuatahi mō taua paihana motuhake.

translations.source_text: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te kupu pepeke e whakamahia ana e nga kai-whakamaori mate mo tenei roopu pepeke.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te kupu ngārara, e ai ki ngā tohunga ngārara mō tēnei momo horopaki, he pēpeke.

translations.source_text: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
translations.pred_target_text: I ahu mai tenei kupu i te taunga o mua ki te Bed-bugs, he ngarara kua tino urutau ki te whakatoi i te tangata.
translations.true_target_text: Kei te ahu mai tēnei kupu i te waiatanga tahito ki ngā Bed-bugs, arā, he pepeke kua tino urutau ki te noho pirinoa ki te tangata.

translations.source_text: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga kaipatu-kohuru me nga pepeke-moenga he kino, he pai ki te noho i roto i te kohanga, i te whare ranei o to ratou ope.
translations.true_target_text: Ka whānau pangore mai ngā Assassin-bugs me ngā Bed-bugs, kua whanaketia kia noho ki te kōhanga, ki te kāinga rānei o tō rātou rauropi papa.

translations.source_text: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
translations.pred_target_text: Puta noa i te United States of America, tata ki te 400,000 nga keehi e mohiotia ana mo te Multiple Sclerosis (MS), ka waiho hei mate neuropi matua i roto i nga taiohi me nga pakeke o waenga.
translations.true_target_text: Puta noa i Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika he tata ki te 400,000 kēhi e mōhiotia ana o te Multiple Sclerosis (MS), nō reira ko ia te tahumaero ā-roro matua ki ngā pakeke he rangatahi, he waenga rānei te pakeke.

translations.source_text: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te MS he mate e pa ana ki te punaha nerve matua, he mea hanga mai i te roro, te taurakira me te nerve optic.
translations.true_target_text: Ko MS tētahi tahumaero e pā ana ki te pūnaha ioio matua, e hangaia ana ki te roro, te aho tuaiwi me te ioio mai i te roro ki te karu.

translations.source_text: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
translations.pred_target_text: Kua kitea e te rangahau ko nga wahine e rua nga wa ka nui ake te mate MS i nga tane.
translations.true_target_text: Kua kitea e te rangahau ko te tupono kia pāngia te wahine e te MS e rua whakareatanga ki tā te tāne.

translations.source_text: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka whakatau pea te tokorua ehara i te mea e pai ana ki a raua, ki te hiahia ranei o ta raua tamaiti, ki te whakatipu pepe.
translations.true_target_text: Ka whakatau pea tētahi tokorua kāore i te whai tikanga pai rawa mō rāua, mō tā rāua tamaiti rānei, te whakatipu pēpi.

translations.source_text: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka taea e enei tokorua te whiriwhiri ki te whakarite mahere whakatamariki mo a raatau pepe.
translations.true_target_text: Ka kōwhiri pea ēnei tokorua te hanga i tētahi mahere whāngai mō tā rāua pēpi.

translations.source_text: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
translations.pred_target_text: I roto i te whakatamarikitanga, ka whakamutua e nga matua whanau o ratou mana matua kia ahei ai etahi atu tokorua hei matua i te tamaiti.
translations.true_target_text: Ki te whāngai, ka motu ngā mātua whakawhānau i ō rātou motika ā-mātua kia whakatipuria te tamaiti e tētahi atu tokorua.

translations.source_text: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te whainga matua o te Putaiao ko te kimi i te ahua o te mahi a te ao ma te tikanga putaiao. Ko tenei tikanga ka arahi i te nuinga o nga rangahau pūtaiao.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te whāinga matua a te pūtaiao he mōhio ki te mahinga o te ao mā te tikanga pūtaiao. Ko tēnei tikanga nei hei arataki i te nuinga o ngā rangahau pūtaiao.

translations.source_text: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
translations.pred_target_text: Ehara i te mea ko ia anake, ko te whakamatautau, ko te whakamatautau he whakamatautau ka whakamahia hei whakakore i tetahi, neke atu ranei o nga whakapae ka taea, te patapatai, me te mahi tirohanga hei arahi i te rangahau pūtaiao.
translations.true_target_text: Ehara i te mea ko ia ki tōna kotahi, te mātaitanga, ā, ko te mātaitanga ko tētahi whakamātautau e whakamahia ana hei whakakore i te whakapae kotahi, neke atu rānei ka taea, te ui i ngā pātai, me te whakatātare hei ārahi hoki i ngā rangahau pūtaiao.

translations.source_text: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
translations.pred_target_text: Ua tiatonu te feia ite natura e te mau philosopho i nia i te mau papai tahito e, i nia iho â râ i te Bibilia na roto i te reo Latino.
translations.true_target_text: I aro te hunga aro taiao me ngā wānanga ki ngā pukapuka o nehe, inarā, ki te paipera ki te reo Rātini.

translations.source_text: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakaaehia nga whakaaro o Aristotle mo nga kaupapa katoa o te aoiao, tae atu ki te hinengaro.
translations.true_target_text: I whakaaetia ngā tirohanga o Aristotle ki ngā kaupapa katoa o te pūtaiao, tae atu ki te mātai hinengaro.

translations.source_text: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
translations.pred_target_text: I te hekenga o te matauranga ki te reo Kariki, ka wehea atu a Te Tai Hauauru mai i ona takenga matauranga me te putaiao.
translations.true_target_text: I te heke haere o te reo Kariki, ka haukotia te Uru i ōna pakiaka wānanga, pūtaiao Kariki hoki.

translations.source_text: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga manawataki e kitea ana i roto i te ahuwhenua me te whanonga e whakawhirinaki nui ana ki te noho o nga huringa endogenous me te whakaputanga mai i nga karaka koiora.
translations.true_target_text: He rahi tonu ngā tāngata i mātai i te manawataki o te koiora, e mārama ai ki ngā whanonga me tirohia ngā huringa o te tinana me ngā hua ka puta i ngā mahi a te tinana.

translations.source_text: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga manawataki o ia wa, ehara i te whakautu noa ki nga tohu o waho, kua tuhia mo te nuinga o nga mea ora, tae atu ki nga huakita, nga harore, nga tipu me nga kararehe.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā ia ā-wā, arā, ehara ēnei i ngā urupare noa iho ki ngā tohu ā-wā ki waho, kua kitea mō te tata ki te katoa o ngā koiora, tae atu ki ngā huakita, ngā hekaheka, ngā tipu, ngā kararehe anō hoki.

translations.source_text: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga karaka koiora he oscillators e mau tonu ana i te waa o te eke paihikara kore utu ahakoa kaore he tohu o waho.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā karaka koiora he mea ngapu kei te tautīnei i a rātou anō ka haere tonu te wā o te huringa rere noa ahakoa kei te ngaro ngā tohu nō waho.

translations.source_text: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te whakamatautau a Hershey raua ko Chase tetahi o nga whakaaro nui ko te DNA he taonga ira.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te whakamātautau Hershey me Chase tētahi o ngā whakaaro i whakatau ai he mea ira te pītau ira.

translations.source_text: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
translations.pred_target_text: I whakamahia e Hershey raua ko Chase he phages, he wheori ranei, ki te whakato i a raua ake DNA ki roto i te huakita.
translations.true_target_text: I whakamahingia e Hershey me Chase ngā wāhanga, ngā huaketo rānei hei whakauru i ō rātou ake pītau ira ki roto ki tētahi kitakita.

translations.source_text: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
translations.pred_target_text: I mahia e ratou e rua nga whakamatautau e tohu ana i te DNA i roto i te phage me te ūkuikui radioactive, te pūmua ranei o te phage me te whanariki radioactive.
translations.true_target_text: I whakamahia e rātau ētahi whakamātautau e rua e tohu ana i te pītau ira ki te huaketo he phage te momo me tētahi hīnātore iraruke, ki te pūmua o te huaketo phage me te pūngāwhā iraruke rānei.
