translations.source_text: Singapore is generally an extremely safe place to be and very easy to navigate, and you can buy almost anything after arriving.

translations.pred_target_text: He iti ano nga pahi e haere ana ki te raki ki Heperona, te urupa tuku iho o nga patereareha Paipera a Aperahama, Ihaka, Hakopa, me a ratou wahine.
translations.true_target_text: Tērā hoki ētahi pahi e haere whakateraki ana ki Hebron, te wāhi urupā taketake o te pā whakawairua o Aperehama nō te Paipera, o Ihaka, o Hāpoka me ā rātou wāhine.

translations.source_text: Check that the bus you are thinking of taking goes into Hebron and not just to the nearby Jewish settlement of Kiryat Arba.
translations.pred_target_text: Tirohia ko te pahi e whakaaro ana koe kia eke ki Heperona, kaua ki te kainga Hurai tata ki Kiriat Arba.
translations.true_target_text: Me whakatūturu ko te pahi e whakaaro ana koe kia eke ka haere ki Hebron, kaua ki te kāinga Hūrae tata o Kiryat Arba noa iho.

translations.source_text: Inland waterways can be a good theme to base a holiday around.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga ara wai o uta ka waiho hei kaupapa pai hei turanga hararei.
translations.true_target_text: He pai ngā arawai o uta hei kaupapa ārahi i ō haerenga.

translations.source_text: For example visiting castles in the Loire Valley, the Rhine valley or taking a cruise to interesting cites on the Danube or boating along the Erie Canal.
translations.pred_target_text: Hei tauira ko te toro atu ki nga whare rangatira i te riu o Loire, te riu o Rhine, te haere poti ranei ki nga taone whakamere i te Danube, ka eke poti ranei i te awa o Erie.
translations.true_target_text: Hei tauira ko te toro atu ki ngā whare kīngi ki te Loire Valley, ki te Rhine valley, te eke rānei ki tētahi rerenga waka ki ngā tāone nui manawa reka ki te Danube, te eke waka rānei ki te Erie Canal.

translations.source_text: They also define routes for popular hiking and cycling trails.
translations.pred_target_text: Ka tautuhia e ratou nga huarahi mo nga huarahi hikoi rongonui me nga huarahi paihikara.
translations.true_target_text: Ka tautuhia hoki ngā ara mō te hīkoi rongonui me ngā ara paihikara.

translations.source_text: Christmas is one of the most important holidays of Christianity, and is celebrated as the birthday of Jesus.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te Kirihimete tetahi o nga hararei tino nui o te Karaitiana, a ka whakanuia ko te ra whanau o Ihu.
translations.true_target_text: Ko te Kirihimete ko tētahi o ngā hararei whakahirahira rawa o te Karaitiana, ā, ka whakanuia hei rāwhānau o Ihu.

translations.source_text: Many of the traditions surrounding the holiday have been adopted also by non-believers in Christian countries and non-Christians around the world.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te nuinga o nga tikanga e pa ana ki te hararei kua tangohia e te hunga kore whakapono i roto i nga whenua Karaitiana me te hunga ehara i te Karaitiana huri noa i te ao.
translations.true_target_text: He nui tonu ngā tīkanga mō te hararei kua kawea hoki e ngā tāngata-kore-whakapono i ngā whenua Karaitiana me te hunga ehara i te Karaitiana huri noa i te ao.

translations.source_text: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise.
translations.pred_target_text: He tikanga ki te oho i te po o te Aranga i etahi waahi ka kitea te whitinga o te ra.
translations.true_target_text: Arā tētahi tikanga kia noho oho mō te roanga o te pō Aranga ki tētahi wāhi mārakerake hei kite i te aranga mai o te rā.

translations.source_text: There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko te tikanga he whakamaarama whakapono Karaitiana mo tenei tikanga, engari tera pea he tikanga i mua i te Kirihimete me te Whakawhanaketanga.
translations.true_target_text: He whakamāramatanga ā-hāhi Karaitiana tonu mō tēnei tikanga, engari tonu he ritenga pea nō mua i te wā Karaitiana mō te Kōanga me te Matahua.

translations.source_text: More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.
translations.pred_target_text: He maha nga whare karakia tuku iho e mau ana i te Aranga Aranga i te po o te Hatarei i te mutunga o te wiki o te Aranga, me te maha o nga huihuinga e pakaru ana ki te whakanui i te whiu o waenganui po ki te whakanui i te aranga o te Karaiti.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā whare karakia tūturu ake o mua ka mau tonu ki te Easter Vigil i te pō o te Hatarei i te wā o te mutunga wiki Aranga, ā, ko ngā minenga ka puta ki te whakanuitanga i te wā pū tonu o te tūruawēpō kia whakanui i te aranga mai o Ihu.

translations.source_text: All animals that originally arrived in the islands came here either by swimming, flying or floating.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga kararehe katoa i tae tuatahi mai ki nga motu i tae mai ma te kauhoe, ma te rere, ma te maanu ranei.
translations.true_target_text: Ko ngā kararehe katoa i tae tūturu mai ki ngā motu i tae mai ki konei nā te kaukau, te rere hau, te rere wai rānei.

translations.source_text: Due to the long distance from the continent mammals were unable to make the journey making the giant tortoise the primary grazing animal in the Galapagos.
translations.pred_target_text: Na te tawhiti mai i nga whenua whakangote kare i taea te haere i te honu nui te kararehe whangai tuatahi i nga Galapagos.
translations.true_target_text: E ai ki te roanga mai i te paparahi kāore ngā whāngote i āhei te haere nō reira ko te giant tortoise te kararehe kai otaota matua ki ngā Galapagos.

translations.source_text: Since the arrival of man to the Galapagos, many mammals have been introduced including goats, horses, cows, rats, cats and dogs.
translations.pred_target_text: Mai i te taenga mai o te tangata ki Galapagos, he maha nga kararehe whakangote kua whakauruhia mai ko te koati, te hoiho, te kau, te kiore, te ngeru me te kuri.
translations.true_target_text: Mai anō i te taenga mai o te tangata ki Galapagos, kua tomokia atu ngā tini kararehe pēnei i ngā koti, ngā hoiho, kau, kiore, ngeru me ngā kurī.

translations.source_text: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon.
translations.pred_target_text: Mena ka toro koe ki nga waahi o Arctic, Antarctica ranei i te takurua ka wheako koe i te po polar, ko te tikanga kaore te ra e whiti ki runga ake i te pae.
translations.true_target_text: Mēnā koe ka haere ki te Arctic, ki te Antarctic rānei i ngā wā o te takurua, ka kite koa i te pō poara, tōna tikanga hoki kāore te rā e awatea mai i te paerangi.

translations.source_text: This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock.
translations.pred_target_text: He waahi pai tenei ki te kite i te Aurora borealis, na te mea ka pouri te rangi i nga wa katoa o te karaka.
translations.true_target_text: He hoatutanga pai tēnei kia kite ai i ngā Aurora Borealis, i te mea ka pōuri te rangi mō te roanga o te huringa o te karaka.

translations.source_text: As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.
translations.pred_target_text: I te mea he iti te noho o nga waahi, me te parahanga marama na reira kaore he raru, ka koa koe ki nga whetu.
translations.true_target_text: I te mea kua itiiti nei te rahinga tāngata, kāore he tino raruraru o te parakino-raiti, ā, ka manawareka anō hoki koe ki ngā whetū.

translations.source_text: Japanese work culture is more hierarchical and formal that what Westerners may be used to.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga tikanga mahi a Hapanihi he nui ake te hierarchy me te okawa ki nga mahi a nga tangata o te Tai Hauauru.
translations.true_target_text: He nui ake te ara ā-kapa, te ōkawa hoki o te ahurea mahi o Hapani i tā te hunga Uru e waia ana.

translations.source_text: Suits are standard business attire, and coworkers call each other by their family names or by job titles.
translations.pred_target_text: Ko nga kakahu he kakahu pakihi paerewa, a ka karanga nga hoa mahi ki a ratau ma o ratau whanau me o raatau taitara mahi.
translations.true_target_text: He māori noa te mau hūtu mō te pakihi, ā, ka karangatia ngā kaimahi e rātou ake ki ō rātou ingoa whānau ki ō rātou taitara mahi hoki rānei.

translations.source_text: Workplace harmony is crucial, emphasizing group effort rather than praising individual accomplishments.
translations.pred_target_text: He mea nui te noho pai ki te waahi mahi, me te whakanui i nga mahi a te roopu, kaua ki te whakanui i nga whakatutukitanga takitahi.
translations.true_target_text: He mea waiwai te reretahi ki te wāhi mahi, me te aro atu ki te mahi a te rōpū kaua ko te mihi ki ngā ekenga takitahi.

translations.source_text: Workers must often get their superiors' approval for any decisions they make, and are expected to obey their superiors' instructions without question.
translations.pred_target_text: Me whiwhi nga kaimahi i te whakaaetanga a o ratou rangatira mo nga whakatau ka mahia e ratou, me te tumanako ki te whakarongo ki nga tohutohu a o ratou rangatira me te kore patai.
translations.true_target_text: He nui ngā wā me whai whakaaetanga ngā kaimahi i ō rātou rangatira mō ngā whakatau katoa, ā, e hiahiatia ana ka whai rātou i ngā tohutohu o ō rātou rangatira horekau te pātai atu.
